title: Helicopter Pilot - HAA - Located in Cedar Rapids, IA
description:
Located in Cedar Rapids, IA

Job Description

 If your passion is flying and you want to work in an environment where every second counts - contact us today!

Increased Wages as of Jul 8 '22!

15K Sign on Bonus

40K Retention Bonus after 3 years

18% Geo Modifier

On Duty Housing

We're hiring a Helicopter Pilot to provide medical air transportation services to our customers. Scheduled shifts run seven consecutive days on and off . Safety is a key pillar of our services

Responsibilities
  • Working with a team of medical experts to safely transport customers to and from locations and facilities
  • Ensure aircraft readiness for flight dispatches as described in the appropriate manuals, including all FAR and company requirements, and aircraft cleanliness duties
  • Maintain accurate company and regulatory documentation and record keeping
  • Effectively communicate and collaborate with dispatch, flight crews, facilities, and partners
  • Provide shift change info to successive pilot and team following protocol for recording MTC change board details
  • Accountable to maintain required certifications and ongoing training
Minimum Requirements
  • Current Rotorcraft FAA Commercial Certificate
  • Helicopter instrument rating
  • Current FAA Class II Medical Certificate
  • 2,000 Total Flight Hours
  • 1,500 Helicopter Hours
  • 1,000 Helicopter PIC Hours
  • 1,000 Hours Turbine
B407 Experience Preferred

 Please upload your Pilot License and FAA Medical Certificate

Why Choose Med-Trans? As a leader in air medical care, Med-Trans is one of Global Medical Response 's (GMR) family of solutions. Our GMR teams deliver compassionate, quality medical care, primarily in the areas of emergency and patient relocation services. View the stories on how our employees provide care to the world at www.AtaMomentsNotice.com . Learn how our values are at the core of our services and vital to how we approach care and check out our comprehensive benefit options at GlobalMedicalResponse.com/Careers

EEO Statement

Global Medical Response and its family of companies are an Equal Opportunity Employer, which includes supporting veterans and providing reasonable accommodations for individuals with a disability.

Required

Preferred

Job Industries
  • Customer Service

title: Housekeeper
description:
SCHEDULE -

Monday - Friday

5:00pm - 8:00pm

Job Title: Housekeeper - Rankin County Schools

Basic Scope/Purpose

Perform all related tasks that are needed to ensure the assigned job-related responsibilities are carried out so the assigned building/account is cleaned to the standards of ServiceMaster and the customer task list.

Description Of Duties
  • Follow the task list for your assigned building or assigned position. Carry out assigned tasks within the time allotted. *(See General Task List Below)
  • Maintain your janitorial closet clean, neat, and organized.
  • Keep equipment clean and supplies organized.
  • Obtain and maintain passing scores on janitorial Quality Assurance inspections.
  • Communicate regularly with your supervisor and division manager to ensure that you have the items needed to perform your job and that you are meeting the customer’s expectations.
  • Communicate with your customer at your assigned facility as needed.
  • Maintain a safe work environment by ensuring that wet floor signs are used when mopping floors, spray bottles and other containers are appropriately labeled, and your work area is secured at all times.
  • Secure your building or area once you have completed your assigned tasks.
  • General Task List,
(Maybe specific details associated with an account that are not listed below.)
  • Spot clean entrance door glass
  • Vacuum carpet and carpet runner
  • Dry and damp mop hard surface floor
  • Empty trash, replace liners as needed
  • Dust ledges and other horizontal surfaces
  • Dust all desks (cleared areas) and chairs
  • Sanitize telephones
  • Spot clean walls for finger prints and smudges
  • Vacuum carpeted traffic areas
  • Vacuum carpet wall to wall
  • High and low dust all horizontal surfaces
  • Dry and damp mop hard surface floors
  • Empty trash, replace liners as needed
  • Damp wipe (sanitize) tables
  • Dry and damp mop floor
  • Clean and sanitize: sink, counter and outside of microwave
  • Fill soap and paper towel dispenser
  • Dust ledges and other horizontal surfaces
  • Arrange furniture as needed
  • Empty trash, replace liners as needed
  • Replace all disposable items: toilet paper, hand towels and soap
  • Clean and sanitize: sinks, toilets and urinals
  • Dry and damp mop tile floors
  • Notify building contact of irregularities and maintenance needs
  • Turn off all lights (except those designated), secure building and set alarm
Compensation: $8.50 per hour

Built on a foundation of great brands and employees with a passion for service, our vision is to be the leading provider of essential services through empowered people, world-class customer service and convenient access. By joining ServiceMaster, you'll be part of a talented network of employees with a shared vision.

Our environment is a diverse community where successful people work together to achieve common goals.

This franchise is independently owned and operated by a ServiceMaster Clean® franchisee. Your application will go directly to the franchisee, and all hiring decisions will be made by the management of this franchisee. All inquiries about employment at this location should be made directly to the franchisee, and not to The ServiceMaster Company, LLC.

title: Charge Nurse NICU
description:
• Overview* Dominican Hospital (a member of Dignity Health) is a 222-bed facility that offers a wide range of services to residents of California’s Central Coast. With 24/7 emergency care comprehensive care in cardiac orthopedics oncology women’s and children’s services we continue to lead the region in medical innovation and excellence in healthcare. Comprehensive CareDominican offers emergency services and is a Certified Stroke Center and Chest Pain Center. Dominican’s services include the only comprehensive Cancer Center in Santa Cruz County a Total Joint Replacement program and advanced neurological and endoscopic services. Dominican regularly receives ‘A’ grades for hospital safety from Leapfrog Group and has received national recognition for superior patient safety cardiac care and stroke treatment from Healthgrades a leading provider of comprehensive information about physicians and hospitals.As Santa Cruz County’s heart attack (STEMI) receiving center Dominican Hospital provides cutting edge cardiac care. The hospital’s heart attack treatment times consistently beat the national average and the hospital offers two cardiac catheterization labs available 24 hours a day 7 days a week. Groundbreaking cardiac procedures at Dominican include the Transcatheter Aortic Valve Replacement (TAVR) procedure which allows for heart valve replacement without opening a patient’s chest.Dominican Hospital has forged significant partnerships with area hospitals to bring exceptional care to Santa Cruz County. The hospital offers a level III Neonatal Intensive Care Unit (NICU) through a partnership with Lucile Packard Children’s Hospital Stanford. Neurosurgery at Dominican is also offered through a partnership with Stanford Health Care.
  • Responsibilities* The Charge Nurse functions as a part of a leadership team designed to plan, organize, and control the health care process for applicable patient populations through the unit level management of assigned clinical process while assuming the responsibility and accountability for assigned shift operations. Continually works toward achieving patient satisfaction, productivity, financial and operational objectives. The Charge Nurse coordinates unit responsibilities, and supervises and assigns duties to unit staff. Reports directly to the Department Director.
  • Position Summary:* Under the direction of the Department Manager, provides leadership and supervision to Neonatal Intensive Care staff, in accordance with professional standards and Dominican Hospitals, policies and procedures. The charge nurse has 12 hour responsibility, seven days a week, for the NICU shift assigned.
  • Qualifications*
Educational Requirements
  • Required:*
  • Specialty certification within 3 years of obtaining position
  • License/Registration/Certification: *
  • Current and active CA RN license
  • Current BLS certification
  • Unit specific certifications and qualifications (ex: PALS, ACLS, Chemotherapy)
  • Current NRP certification required.

title: Entry Level Freight Handler
description:
• Description:* Candidates considered for the warehouse role will be responsible for performing all duties as a freight handler. All candidates must be willing to unload/load freight from containers, palletize and performing quality checks on product. Candidates must be willing to lift 50-75 lbs. on a regular basis.
  • Shift - 3:00pm - 11:30pm Monday-Friday W/Overtime and occasional Saturday*
  • Pay : $20 Hourly W/Overtime Pay*
  • Location : Kent, WA*
  • Skills:*
  • Loading/Unloading
  • Warehouse duties
  • Ability to lift 50-75 lbs. repeatedly. Occasionally will lift 120 lbs. between two people.
  • Attention to detail with reading numbers and SKUs
  • Willingness to unload trucks for entirety of the shift
  • Experience Level:* Entry Level

About Aerotek:

We know that a company's success starts with its employees. We also know that an individual's success starts with the right career opportunity. As a Best of Staffing® Client and Talent leader, Aerotek's people-focused approach yields competitive advantage for our clients and rewarding careers for our contract employees. Since 1983, Aerotek has grown to become a leader in recruiting and staffing services. With more than 250 non-franchised offices, Aerotek's 8,000 internal employees serve more than 300,000 contract employees and 18,000 clients every year. Aerotek is an Allegis Group company, the global leader in talent solutions. Learn more at Aerotek.com. The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: Commodity Manager - Forgings (REMOTE)
description:
The Commodity Manager will be required to develop and/or implement a series of commodity strategies, for military and commercial programs, to achieve best value, effective asset management, continuous quality improvement, and delivery cycle time performance improvements that supports both the Enterprise and respective business unit and supply chain management strategic plans.

Remote: Employees who are working in Remote roles will work primarily offsite (from home). An employee may be expected to travel to the site location as needed. This role will be required to periodically travel to supplier and Collins sites in Canada and the U.S. approximately 30% - 40%. Travel is driven by business needs, which may not be a set schedule.

Primary Responsibilities
  • Evaluate market conditions to maintain inventory levels and control costs and make recommendations for cost reduction
  • Evaluate and recommend suppliers, manage ongoing relationships with suppliers
  • Act as an owner of commercial relationship with strategic suppliers
  • Develop and/or maintain commodity sourcing strategies
  • Develop, negotiate and administer supplier contracts
  • Manage product transitions between suppliers
  • Coordinate supplier improvement activities including continuous improvement (CI) events,
  • Perform strategic sourcing activities in support of customer requests or internal projects including sending out RFQs, reviewing responses, supplier selection, coordination with estimating and Program Management and PO or contract file documentation. Ensure these activities meet all Collins and applicable government (FAR) requirements.
  • Organize, lead, and manage supplier meetings regarding strategic initiatives, new work placed at the supplier, performance issues (cost, delivery and quality) and routine program or business reviews.
  • Coordinate/support supply- based transitions.
  • Perform expedites at suppliers, when required
  • Perform other duties as assigned

Basic Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree and 5 years of prior relevant experience OR
  • Advanced Degree in a related field and minimum 3 years of experience OR
  • In absence of a degree, 9 years of relevant experience is required
  • Must be a U.S. Person/Permanent Resident “Green Card” holder

    • Preferred Qualifications
    • Experience in commodity management/supply chain/procurement with increasing levels of responsibility.
    • Working knowledge of: Certified and non-certified Cost and Pricing requirements, Cost Accounting Standards (CAS) requirements on Gov’t Orders, DDTC requirements for Military orders, Truth in Negotiations Act (TINA) requirements for single/sole source Military orders, Negotiations of single/sole source Military orders, and experience in Gov’t Audits.
    • Demonstrated ability to establish credibility with business counterparts
    • Experience managing or leading projects or programs including contract negotiations with minimal supervision
    • Demonstrated success in developing tactical plans and carrying through to successful execution
    • Knowledge of aerospace manufacturing techniques and procedures
    • Ability to effectively communicate and present to senior leadership

    Collins Aerospace, a Raytheon Technologies company, is a leader in technologically advanced and intelligent solutions for the global aerospace and defense industry. Collins Aerospace has the capabilities, comprehensive portfolio and expertise to solve customers’ toughest challenges and to meet the demands of a rapidly evolving global market.

    Our Advanced Structures team leverages advanced materials and additive manufacturing to develop complex interior and exterior solutions. These solutions ensure structural integrity of the aircraft, help aircraft take off and land, stay trim in the air, move forward, carry cargo and conduct rescues. We delight our customers with superior products and best-in-class service. Our global team is committed to continuous improvement – we work hard to make our solutions lighter-weight, stronger and more technically advanced, so that plane travel can be safer, more affordable and more sustainable in the years to come. We are looking for the best and brightest to fly and land with us!

    Collins Aerospace Diversity & Inclusion Statement

    Diversity drives innovation; inclusion drives success. We believe a multitude of approaches and ideas enable us to deliver the best results for our workforce, workplace, and customers. We are committed to fostering a culture where all employees can share their passions and ideas so we can tackle the toughest challenges in our industry and pave new paths to limitless possibility.

    WE ARE REDEFINING AEROSPACE.
    • Please consider the following role type definitions as you apply for this role.

    Onsite: Employees who are working in Onsite roles will work primarily onsite. This includes all production and maintenance employees, as they are essential to the development of our products.

    Hybrid: Employees who are working in Hybrid roles will work regularly both onsite and offsite. Ratio of time working onsite will be determined in partnership with your leader.

    Remote: Employees who are working in Remote roles will work primarily offsite (from home). An employee may be expected to travel to the site location as needed.

    Regardless of your role type, collaboration and innovation are critical to our business and all employees will have access to digital tools so they can work with colleagues around the world – and access to Collins sites when their work requires in-person meetings.

    Some Of Our Competitive Benefits Package Includes
    • Medical, dental, and vision insurance
    • Three weeks of vacation for newly hired employees
    • Generous 401(k) plan that includes employer matching funds and separate employer retirement contribution, including a Lifetime Income Strategy option
    • Tuition reimbursement program
    • Student Loan Repayment Program
    • Life insurance and disability coverage
    • Optional coverages you can buy: pet insurance, home and auto insurance, additional life and accident insurance, critical illness insurance, group legal, ID theft protection
    • Birth, adoption, parental leave benefits
    • Ovia Health, fertility, and family planning
    • Adoption Assistance
    • Autism Benefit
    • Employee Assistance Plan, including up to 10 free counseling sessions
    • Healthy You Incentives, wellness rewards program
    • Doctor on Demand, virtual doctor visits
    • Bright Horizons, child and elder care services
    • Teladoc Medical Experts, second opinion program
    •  And more! 

    Nothing matters more to Collins Aerospace than our strong ethical and safety commitments. As such, all U.S. positions require a background check, which may include a drug screen.

    Note
    • Background check and drug screen required (every external new hire in the U.S.)
    • Drug Screen only performed on re-hires who have been gone for more than 1 year

    At Collins, the paths we pave together lead to limitless possibility. And the bonds we form – with our customers and with each other -- propel us all higher, again and again.

    Apply now and be part of the team that’s redefining aerospace, every day.

    Raytheon Technologies is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age or any other federally protected class.

title: 英文期刊编辑
company_name: 西安欧尔意信息科技有限公司
description:
职位来源于智联招聘。

1、岗位职责
  • 高效达成期刊每阶段高质量特刊建设的指标、来稿指标、出版指标；
  • 高效完成稿件的处理及组织稿件的同行评审并确保同行评审按质按时交付；
  • 高质量的学术会议合作、会议宣传、学协会合作；
  • 高资历的编委邀约加盟、协助责编召开编委会、研讨会；
  • 通过在自媒体平台及时发布科研动态，促进科研成果的传播；
  • 负责新刊选题策划及创办工作；
2、任职资格
  • 稿件处理能力突出、编辑基础知识扎实，从事助理编辑6个月以上；
  • 对期刊的优势、机遇和挑战有全面了解；
  • 独立建特刊/新刊的能力突出，能独立完成期刊的学科调研、撰写学科热点调研报告，并对该领域专家背景做调查、分析，找出特刊意向专家，完成高质量特刊的建设；
  • 熟悉期刊的行业会议、行业学协会，对该领域知名专家、活跃的中青年专家有全面的了解和掌握；
  • 对特刊意向作者的挖掘、跟进、以及促成投稿经验丰富、结果突出；
  • 有研讨会、编委会及各类会议合作的成功经验；
有邮件推广文章的经验，对自媒体宣传期刊有成熟的想法。

以担保或任何理由索要财物，扣押证照，均涉嫌违法。

title: Pipefitter / Pipe Welder
description:
WE ARE CURRENTLY HIRING PIPEFITTERS AND PIPE WELDERS FOR A PRESTIGOUS COMPANY's PROJECT IN HAVRE DE GRACE, MD. SHIFT IS MONDAY-FRIDAY 7AM-4PM. PAY STARTS AT $28-$35/HOUR AND IS DEPENDANT ON EXPERIENCE (WELD TEST FOR WELDERS). THEY ARE LOOKING TO INTERVIEW AND HIRE ASAP SO PLEASE APPLY AND A RECRUITER WILL REACH OUT WITHIN 24 BUSINESS HOURS! PREVIOUS FITTING AND WELDING EXPERIENCE REQUIRED (4-7 YEARS EXPERIENCE EITHER FITTING OR WELDING PIPE)
  • Description:* The pipe fitter will be responsible for understanding critical isometric drawings to cut and fit pipe together for various types of process equipment and machinery.

The ability to read and process information for construction or fabrication is the main function of this position.

The Pipe Fitter will work with various types of valves, fittings, filters, and associated parts for piping systems.

Candidate will also be expected to work off of elevated platforms, high-reach equipment, elevated pipe racks, etc. Pipe Machine, burning torch, grinder, porta-band machine, chain falls, hand tools and mobile equipment.

description:
神奈川県横浜市神奈川区で児童指導員を募集中！ 定員10名の少人数施設！ひとりひとりの個性に合わせた療育・自立支援学習を提供している放課後等デイサービス！ 募集職種: 児童指導員 仕事内容: 教務・事務スタッフ業務 ・障がい児（主に知的・発達）を対象として、各利用者様の発達段階に合ったプログラムで学習に取り組む力やルール・約束を守るコミュニケーション能力を身につける支援を行っております。もちろん、学習だけではなく遊びの時間も通じて能力を高めるお手伝いをしていきます。 ※雇用期間の定めあり（6ヶ月、原則更新） 資格: 児童指導員任用資格をお持ちの方の募集となります。 （高校卒業後２年以上指導員として実務経験がある方も含みます。） 要普通運転免許（AT可） 勤務時間: 平日

11:00~19:00 学休日 10:00~18:00 休憩時間 60分 休日・休暇: 週休二日制 年間休日113日 福利厚生: 雇用保険、健康保険、厚生年金 アピールポイント: #「カナガク放課後デイ 横浜西口」をご紹介します ・カナガク放課後デイでは、障がいをお持ちのお子さんたちに学ぶことの楽しさを伝えるため、ひとりひとりに合わせた療育に取り組んでいます。 ・大切にしているのは本人・ご家族の意思や希望。個別のメニューで楽しく学べる環境づくりを行っています。 ・楽しく時間を過ごしながら自立を目指せる、そんな施設が私たちの目標です。 #楽しく仕事に取り組める職場です ・１日の定員が10名という小規模な施設なので、業務に追われることなくゆとりを持って仕事に取り組んでいただける環境です。 ・仕事への取り組みや頑張りが目に見える形で還元されるよう昇給も行っています。 ・子どもたちはもちろんスタッフの笑顔も広がる雰囲気の良い職場です。日々気持ち良く働いていただけますよ。 真心をこめた療育を提供している放課後等デイサービスで、あなたもぜひ働いてみませんか？ 特徴: 社会保険完備 / 週休2日 / ボーナス・賞与あり / 交通費支給 / 新卒可 / 保育士 / 自動車運転免許 / 放課後等デイサービス / 小学校教諭 / 中学校教諭 / 高等学校教諭 給与の備考: 昇給 年1回 賞与 年2回（歩合制） 通勤手当 ※賃金は経験・資格により決定 ※昇給・賞与は勤務実績・会社業績等による 勤続支援金: 契約職員:12,000円 【施設情報】 施設名: カナガク自立支援学習センター放課後デイ 横浜西口 勤務地: 神奈川県横浜市神奈川区鶴屋町3-33-14 第1米林ビル ブルーライン 横浜駅から徒歩で6分 東急東横線 横浜駅から徒歩で9分 みなとみらい線 横浜駅から徒歩で9分 利用者定員数: 定員 10名 【選考プロセス】 [1] ジョブメドレーの応募フォームよりご応募ください ↓ [2] 採用担当より面接日程の調整などの連絡をさせていただきます ↓ [3] 面接実施 ↓ [4] 採用決定のご連絡 ↓ [5] 入職手続きを進めつつ、ジョブメドレーから勤続支援金をご申請ください ※応募から内定までは平均1週間～1ヶ月ほどになります。 ※在職中で今すぐ転職が難しい方も調整のご相談が可能です。 神奈川県横浜市神奈川区で児童指導員を募集中！ 定員10名の少人数施設！ひとりひとりの個性に合わせた療育・自立支援学習を提供している放課後等デイサービス！ 募集職種: 児童指導員 仕事内容: 教務・事務スタッフ業務 ・障がい児（主に知的・発達）を対象として、各利用者様の発達段階に合ったプログラムで学習に取り組む力やルール・約束を守るコミュニケーション能力を身につける支援を行っております。もちろん、学習だけではなく遊びの時間も通じて能力を高めるお手伝いをしていきます。 ※雇用期間の定めあり（6ヶ月、原則更新） 資格: 児童指導員任用資格をお持ちの方の募集となります。 （高校卒業後２年以上指導員として実務経験がある方も含みます。） 要普通運転免許（AT可） 勤務時間: 平日

title: Laboratory Technician - Entry Level (Must Have INSTRON Exp)
description:
Position : Laboratory Technician – Entry Level (Must Have INSTRON Exp)

Location : Franklin Lakes, NJ

Duration : 12 Months

Total Hours/week : 40.00

Client: Medical Device Company

Job Category: Engineering

Level Of Experience: Entry Level

Employment Type: Contract on W2 (Need US Citizens Or GC Holders Only)

Job Description
  • This laboratory technician will mainly perform bench-level mechanical tests of medical devices, while following written test procedures and not requiring constant supervision.
  • Typical work includes hands-on measurement of tension and compression forces on products.
  • Because this is a highly regulated business, the technician must also vigilantly comply with procedures typical in a medical device company.
  • The technician must be able to follow detailed technical instructions, constantly maintain attention to detail during testing, and accurately record and report test data.
Applicants MUST Meet The Following Requirements
  • Experience with using testing equipment in a laboratory or in QC
  • Able to maintain concentration and attention to detail throughout long test durations
  • Good written and oral communication skills
  • Able to use PC software including Excel
The Following Are Desired
  • Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical or Biomechanical engineering
  • Experience working in a regulated industry such as automotive or medical device
  • Experience in using mechanical testing machines such as the Instron
  • Knowledge of statistical analysis and Minitab software

title: 5th Grade Elementary Teacher (Math & Science) (Cadence)
company_name: Coral Academy of Science Las Vegas
description:
Primary Purpose/Function

The teacher will implement into daily student instruction an appropriate educational curriculum. The teacher will create and maintain an educational atmosphere that encourages effective student learning and supports school and CASLV programs and goals. This person will be expected to adhere to the CASLV Professional Standards for Licensed Employees and report directly to the school site administrator.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities

This list of Essential Duties and Responsibilities is not exhaustive and may be supplemented.
  • Administer appropriate CASLV curriculum which is aligned with the Nevada State Standards.
  • Ensure the opportunity for all students to learn in a supportive environment.
  • Create and maintain a positive, orderly, and academically focused learning condition in the instructional environment.
  • Develop and implement the Components of an Effective Lesson for instruction.
  • Analyze student progress and provide appropriate instruction.
  • Provide a classroom management/discipline plan ensuring safety at all times.
  • Ensure assessment regulations and guidelines are followed at all times.
  • Develop a classroom climate that promotes positive learning conditions.
  • Work professionally with administration, staff, parents, and community.
  • Integrate technology into the instructional program.
  • Participate in other job-related duties and activities related to the position as assigned.
Candidates must hold a valid Nevada teaching license with proper endorsement, OR a valid out-of-state teaching certificate that can be transferred as soon as possible.

title: Purchased Referred Care Coordinator Omaha
description:
Position

Purchased Referred Care Coordinator

Position Number

420

Division

Health

Department

Population Health Services

Reports To

Chief Operating Officer

Location:

Omaha

Exempt/Non-Exempt

Non-exempt

Pay Grade

Grade 6 ($32,552.00-$51,873.27)

Classification

Full-Time (grant funded)

Summary

This is an essential health care services program support staff. The primary purpose is to set up and coordinate referral appointments for patients needing services outside of the Ponca Health Services. Appropriate and timely consultation and referrals are made in order to ensure Ponca Health Services (PHS) is providing high-quality health care.

Essential Responsibilities And Duties
  • Verify Purchased/Referred Care (PRC) Registration packet is current and coordinate necessary documentation updates with team members and patients.
  • Process, schedule, track, and coordinate all referrals to outside providers for Medical Clinic patients per established standard operating procedures.
  • Work directly with patients to determine the best times and date for their referral appointments. Notify patients by mail or phone of scheduled appointments and explain details of appointment and any requirements.
  • Help coordinate urgent/same day referrals. Ensure urgent/emergency referral is included in the referral process.
  • Verify referrals were received with outside providers and confirm exam specifics when needed.
  • Provide patient demographics and copies of patient records to outside providers for scheduled referral appointments and/or continuity of care. Send both demographics and patient records to outside providers for review prior to scheduled appointments.
  • For Purchased/Referred Care eligible patients - send referral and/or patient records to PRC for authorization; track PRC referrals.
  • Seek all additional prior authorizations(s) from patient's insurance as required. Seek prior authorization from hospital and other providers, as needed. Use electronic systems when available.
  • Hospital Discharge Care Coordination upon notification.
  • Coordinate appointments with all Transportation programs as needed.
  • Referral close out: Follow up to ensure the consultation report is received from the outside provider and is placed in the patient's electronic health records (EHR).
  • Keep referral provider list current; update addresses, phone numbers, fax numbers and accepted insurances.
  • Provides back-up and coverage to Patient Care Coordinators when assigned.
  • Establish and maintain an effective filing & tracking system.
  • Provide various medical clinic reports, as directed.
  • Performs other duties as assigned.
Relationships And Authority

This position has no supervisory duties.

Working Environment And Physical Demands

This position is located in professional office environment. Professional work place revolves around same setting of office attire. Stressful environment in dealing with clients, vendors and other service agencies. Sits, stands, bends, lifts, and moves intermittently during work hours. Is subject to emotionally upset patients, family members, personnel, and visitors.

Minimum

Qualifications:
  • High school diploma/GED equivalent
  • Certified Nurse Assistant, Medical Assistant or LPN training/or certification
  • Two years' experience in direct interaction with medical patients
  • Records management experience
  • Excellent time management and organizations skills
  • Strong analytical thinking and the ability to handle multiple tasks concurrently
  • Computer proficiency with Word, Excel spreadsheets, PowerPoint
  • Must possess excellent written and oral communication skills.
  • Resourcefulness in problem solving
  • Valid driver's license and be insurable
  • Successfully pass drug and alcohol testing, motor vehicle, education, character, and criminal background checks
  • Able and willing to travel
Preferred
  • First Aid and CPR Certified
  • Knowledge and understanding of Public Law 93-638 Indian Self-Determination Act
  • One year experience working with Native Americans or Native American organizations
Preference will be given to Ponca Tribe of Nebraska members or members of a federally recognized tribe. However, all qualified individuals are eligible.

The Ponca Tribe of Nebraska is an at-will employer.

Tribal Council Approval: 06/21/22

Human Resources Final: 06/22/22

Designation

PHS Category:

Specify

Risk Exposure Level

Low/Moderate/High

Low

Annual Credentialing

Yes/No

IT Privilege

Aprima/Dentrix/ScriptPro/Other

Aprima

title: Installatiemonteur
description:
Jouw nieuwe baan

Wat ga je doen als installatiemonteur?

Smart home, televisies, audioapparatuur, witgoed; als Installatie/inbouwmonteur installeer jij het allemaal.

Jij maakt onze klanten écht blij en bent als monteur het visitekaartje van BCC.

Plezier maken, je komt terecht in een team met enthousiaste collega’s.

Van maandag tot en met vrijdag, of toch liever werken op zaterdag? Alles kan. Je begint ‘s ochtends om 7:00 uur.

Dankzij jou worden de installaties van onze producten bij klanten thuis uitgevoerd en maak jij hen élke dag weer blij. Als fulltime of parttime installatiemonteur in Apeldoornben jij samen met je collega’s verantwoordelijk voor de regio Holland-Midden . Je hebt veel vrijheid in je werk en vindt het leuk om onderweg te zijn. Je komt bij verschillende klanten over de vloer en voert diverse installaties uit. Als installatiemonteur is elke dag weer anders en met jouw expertise heb je altijd een oplossing in huis. Heb jij nog geen ervaring, maar wél twee rechterhanden? Geen probleem, wij leren je alles!

Jouw nieuwe werkgever

BCC is de leverncier van elektronica produten.

We helpen je om snel en zorgeloos te genieten van je elektronica.

Of het nou gaat om een televisie, laptop of wasmachine, we helpen je.

Van deskundig advies tot bezorgen en vakkundig installeren.

We helpen je thuis, in de winkel en online.

We helpen je met veel plezier.

Wat vragen we van jou?

Wie ben jij?

Jij hebt twee rechterhanden, bent fysiek sterk en weet van aanpakken.

Jij hebt een rijbewijs B.

Jij denkt niet in problemen, maar biedt altijd de oplossing aan onze klanten.

Jij weet de beste service te verlenen en de klant een ‘wow’ gevoel te geven.

Jij bent het visitekaartje van BCC, zowel aan de deur als op de weg.

Wat bieden we jou?

Bij BCC maken we jouw leven leuker, makkelijker en slimmer! Waarom?

Een parttime of fulltime baan waarbij zowel 8 tot 38 uur per week bespreekbaar is.

Je krijgt veel vrijheid en verantwoordelijkheden.

Een marktconform salaris.

Je kunt direct aan de slag.

25 vakantiedagen bij een werkweek van 38 uur.

Je ontvangt reiskostenvergoeding.

title: Trainee Financial Counsellor
description:
Number Of Positions Available

2

Start your career with The Salvation Army today!

We are looking for compassionate people who share our mission and values, if you have the passion and drive to commit yourself to a challenging and rewarding role; we invite you to review our current vacancies.

About Us

The Salvation Army is one of Australia’s largest and most-loved charities, helping thousands of Australians every year find hope in the midst of all kinds of personal hardship. The Salvation Army offers the opportunity to use your professional skills and expertise to make a real difference in the lives of people who need help most.

Our trainee Financial Counsellors provide basic financial counselling to clients and communities. This position is an opportunity to transition into financial counselling role whilst studying Diploma in Financial Counselling.

Our Financial Counsellors provide financial counselling to clients and conduct thorough assessment processes that ensures that clients receive a prompt and efficient service. Integrate this with state-wide telephone financial counselling service (Moneycare).

About The Role

We are seeking a trainee financial counsellor to provide a holistic financial counselling and advocacy service to people in financial difficulty or crisis which recognises the ways in which other life issues may interact with personal financial issues, considers the clients’ unique circumstances, their financial history and financial behaviours.

Other Responsibilities Include
  • Conduct group community education (financial literacy/capability) sessions where appropriate and in consultation with the Moneycare Manager with a view to helping people build longer-term capability, manage their money better and make informed choices
  • Operate the local Moneycare practice with autonomy but within TSA and Moneycare policy and procedure, managing own scheduling, case load and reporting of statistical data.
This is a fixed term position until 30 June 2023 covering Western Sydney. Exact location will be discussed with interested candidates.

About You
  • Willingness to undertake Diploma of Community Services – Financial Counselling or just commenced Diploma of Financial Counselling.
  • Minimum of 2 years experience in a similar role
  • Accreditation as a Financial Counsellor (member of FCAN) or be willing to attain accreditation as soon as possible.
  • Knowledge of the relevant legislation and information pertaining to financial issues or any other para legal experience.
  • Demonstrated high level interpersonal, active listening and analytical skills.
  • Proficiency working within a Windows Office environment.
  • Compassionate and non-judgmental.
  • Ability to summon confidence and faith of client.
  • Willingness to travel on occasion for training and development.
  • Clear Working with Children Check NSW
  • An appreciation of and the ability and willingness to promote and support the values and ethos of The Salvation Army.
  • Ability to meet deadlines and work under conflicting time pressures.
  • Demonstrated ability to work with different cultures and backgrounds.
  • Demonstrated money management and negotiation skills
  • Demonstrated ability to work with people suffering difficulties and crisis.
  • Demonstrated ability to work within a counselling framework is highly regarded
Enquiries: Contact Masa McCullum or Rovind Kant on 02 9633 5011

The Salvation Army is an Equal Opportunity Employer who provides an inclusive work environment and embraces the diverse talent of its people. We value people of all cultures, languages, capacities, sexual orientations, gender identities and/or expressions. We are committed to achieving a diverse workforce and strongly encourage applications from Aboriginal people and Torres Strait Islander people.

The Salvation Army is a child safe organisation and is committed to protecting children and young people from harm. All child facing roles will require the successful completion of a Working with Children Check. Applicants for all roles require a mandatory National Police Check.

We are committed to providing a safe environment for our people. Please note that The Salvation Army has a mandatory vaccination procedure.

We value Integrity, Compassion, Respect, Diversity, and Collaboration

title: Senior Tax Accountant
description:
Summary Of Responsibilities

Senior Accountant will be responsible for the review of various types of intermediate tax returns as well as tax planning and other bookkeeping and audit related tasks. They will take part in the training, mentoring and general supervision of staff and facilitate individual and in house training. Seniors will also be expected to assist with billing and build working relationships with current and prospective clients.

Qualifications

To perform this job successfully, the incumbent must be able to perform each essential key competency function satisfactorily. The requirements listed are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform these functions.

Must be able to work a flexible schedule which includes 55+ hours a week during tax season.

Seniors must possess Bachelor of Accountancy as well as a CPA or EA license. This may be substituted with equivalent years of experience and continued education in some cases.
  • KEY COMPETENCIES:
  • Prepare HRIS and Axcess timesheets and Excel To Do lists.
  • Achieve monthly and annual charge hour goals.
  • Review of Form 1099's, Sales tax returns, Business Property Statements and Business Licenses.
  • Review of intermediate C-Corporation, Partnership, S-Corporation, Personal, Non-Profit and Trust tax returns.
  • Review of Corporate and Personal tax planning.
  • Manage and maintain control lists and deadlines to ensure timely filing and reporting.
  • Assist in Tax Audits.
  • Participate in mentoring program.
  • Facilitate in house training and meetings as well as provide one on one feedback to staff.
  • Participate in firm recruiting events as well as firm outreach events regarding future potential clients.
  • Assist in billing process by analyzing WIP and providing invoice totals.
  • Communicate and meet with clients regarding current services. Assist with new client proposals and first meeting engagements.
Knowledge And Skills Requirements
  • Ability to understand schedules of tax forms, entity type setup, formation and dissolution, retirement plan options, foreign entity reporting, section 1031 exchanges, basic foreign/multistate returns, POL, PAC and LM2 tax returns and specialized tax credits.
  • Participate in intermediate/advanced continued education as well as assist in developing in house training courses.
  • Ability to conduct intermediate individualized research.
  • Familiar with Accounting related software, to include CFS, AME, CSA, QuickBooks, T-value, Adobe Acrobat, Prosystems Engagement, Checkpoint Tools and Axcess Tax.
  • Working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills..

title: Contingent Maintenance Worker
description:

Shift timings : 1st shift [Mon. Thurs. 6AM - 4:30PM with OT as needed ]

Total Hours/week : 40.00

Description
  • Support production of V. Mueller and Snowden Pencer product lines and equipment/facility
  • Repair and maintain a variety of production and building equipment including mechanical systems. Disassemble, select repair procedure, order parts as needed and repair or replace worn or defective parts using hand and power tools

  • Perform routine carpentry and related work involved in maintaining the facility

  • Demo old equipment that is duplicated with new system and relocate bulk oil storage equipment to new location

title: Solutions Development Executive - AWS - Azure Account Management
description:
Description
At Ingram Micro Cloud, we are constantly pushing the boundaries of what’s possible. Insatiable curiosity and a drive for innovation push us forward to shape the future through the power of technology. For many, it’s no surprise that technology powers the planet. But what might surprise you is that Ingram Micro Cloud can reach more than 90% of the global population. As one of the world’s largest cloud platform providers, we empower businesses to build faster, scale further and maintain sustainable growth for years to come. Earning the Great Place to Work Certification™️ for 2022-2023 in 15 countries around the world reflects our commitment to our people and our culture – we believe our employees are the spark that continually fuels our success.
The opportunity to shape the future through technology awaits – find the role that’s right for you.
This is where YOU come in!
Our ideal candidate is someone who possesses excellent communication skills, thought leadership in their role, and an innovative problem solver who isn’t afraid to think outside-of-the-box to provide the best solutions for our partners.
Proven Track record of success in a Solutions Development Executive (Account Management) for the South East Territory, focused on recruiting new partners and enabling existing partners to execute on their go to market strategy resulting in sales growth.
Responsibilities
  • Build and maintain relationships within the defined geographic territory.
  • Responsible for facilitating the partner journey and influencing the partner to take advantage of the value within Microsoft Azure and AWS products, programs and services capabilities.
  • Providing educational resources, and driving the sale of technical products, programs and/or services.
  • Responsible for growing profitable sales, activations, and market share across the distribution channel by helping your geographic account base from a traditional computer reseller to a profitable Managed Service Provider (MSP) with steady annuity stream. This is an area of explosive growth.
  • Deeply research into partner’s IaaS / PaaS business, and forge relationships with key decision makers and stakeholders.
  • Learn and Maintain a detailed understanding of Microsoft Azure and AWS services and its associated key competitive products including life cycles, pricing programs, and technology advantages.
  • Proactively identify sales opportunities and close sales within their assigned base of Microsoft and AWS partners.
  • Coordinate and collaborate with other Sales resources, aligned in same geography or business unit(s) to ensure we are providing maximum value to our respective partners
  • Be the resident subject matter expert on Microsoft and AWS Partner Networks, and the respective programs impacting partner profitability, to ensure they maximize their consumption of available resources and continue investing in the strategic alignment of IaaS through Ingram Micro.
  • This position is primarily focused on of identifying and earning the business from Net New transacting partners, with a sub component of developing existing Azure and AWS accounts.
  • Travel up to 50% (which may include international travel)
What You Bring To The Role
  • Bachelor’s degree and a minimum of two years previous sales/account management experience (preferably in a related industry) or one-year experience with Ingram Micro in a sales/account management capacity equivalent to a Channel Account Specialist.
  • Minimum of five years previous account management experience or four years’ experience with Ingram Micro in a sales/customer service capacity equivalent to a Channel Account Specialist
  • Knowledge of professional, effective telephone techniques, sales and account management skills.
  • Ability to dig deeper into an organization and take advantage of cross and upsell opportunities.
  • Ability to develop deep technical and product knowledge.
  • Ability to expand that technical knowledge to become a Microsoft and AWS subject matter expert.
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Strong organizational skills and problem-solving skills
  • Ability to work as a team member
  • Must respond to rapid change, perform duties with accuracy and with a strong degree of urgency
  • Prioritize and perform work with minimal supervision
  • Able to handle large quantities of information while maintaining a high level of accuracy
  • Comfortable presenting via screenshare, or in person, in front of executive audiences
  • Ability to overcome objections,
Why Ingram?
  • Competitive tech industry salaries
  • Medical, Dental, Vision
  • 401K Matching
  • Vacation + Sick Days
  • Work Life Balance
  • Paid Parental Leave
  • Continuing Education Reimbursement
  • Commission Structure
  • Bonus Opportunities
  • HSA and FSA
  • Life Insurance
  • Accidental Death and Dismemberment
  • Short- and Long-Term Disability
  • Swag from the coolest vendors in Tech
  • Mentorship & Career Growth Opportunities
This is not a complete listing of the job duties. It’s a representation of the things you will be doing, and you may not perform all these duties.
Please be prepared to pass a drug test and successfully pass a pre-employment (post offer) background check that includes verification of vaccination status.
Ingram Micro requires all new associates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Therefore, this position requires applicants to submit proof, prior to start date, that the successful applicant is fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Ingram Micro will comply with applicable laws regarding the reasonable accommodation of individuals with disabilities and/or sincerely held religious beliefs. Applicants will be notified of the requirements of Ingram Micro’s COVID-19 policy and process for verification of vaccination status prior to the start of employment.
 Ingram Micro believes there is no place in our society for social injustice, discrimination, or racism. As a company we do not – and will not – tolerate these actions.
Ingram Micro Inc. is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status, or any other protected category under applicable law.

title: Maintenance Technician
description:
ProAmpac is currently seeking a Maintenance Technician for the Rochester, NY facility. Our pay and benefits are very competitive along with 11 paid holidays per year and a great wellness program.

Safety is our top priority and ProAmpacs culture is one of people first! If you have good attention to detail, impeccable mechanical skills and want to be a part of a collaborative team that helps produces goods for our nations every-day life, this may be the opportunity for you. The environment is a clean, regulated facility where you will be part of a growing team and on the cutting edge with the addition of a new Collaboration and Innovation Center on campus.

Some Of The Job Responsibilities Include
  • Light machine shop activities.
  • Assist with troubleshooting and repairing electrical problems; performs electrical repairs and installations on non-energized circuits (commensurate with experience or training/certification).
  • Maintains facilities as directed by the Maintenance/Facilities Manager and/or Maintenance Supervisor, including but not limited to snow plowing, salting, yard maintenance, floor cleaning, general cleaning, painting, light electrical, light plumbing.
  • Conducts daily facilities maintenance inspections checks.
  • Assists and observes electro-mechanical/pneumatic devices in operation, diagnoses problems, performs corrective action and insures proper operation post-repair.
  • Disassembles devices to gain access to remove defective parts; uses hoists, cranes, hand tools, power tools and occasionally. Installs repair parts and reassembles devices.
  • Inspects used parts to determine changes and dimensional requirements using measuring instruments.
  • Must be available for call-in and overtime on all shifts.
  • Ability to operate a scissor lift, UTV/snowplow, snow blower, and forklift with a valid license issued by ProAmpac Rochester.
  • Assist and/or perform production equipment set-ups as directed. Operate production equipment as needed in accordance with good manufacturing practices and standard operating procedures.
  • Assist operators in troubleshooting equipment when quality or efficiencies are less than standard.
  • Troubleshoot problems with equipment, devices, or products.
  • Assist Production Department based on scheduled demands.
  • Assist with the managing of Tool Room as needed.
  • Assist engineering with installation, testing and validation of new products and production equipment.
  • Availability Monday through Friday 7:00am to 3:30pm
  • Flexible packaging manufacturing experience a plus.
  • Working knowledge in operation and maintenance of facility management services, plumbing and electrical systems, security systems and equipment maintenance.
  • Exceptional time management and organization skills. Ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously establishing priorities to meet deadlines.
  • Proactive; exercises sound judgment and decision making; able to identify problems and needs and develop solutions and/or options.
Required

Preferred

Job Industries
  • Customer Service

title: Line Cook - Immediate Opening
description:
Role Overview

Our Heart of House Team Members are responsible for setting the pace for a great shift, every shift. They provide dependable, fast service that is absolutely Chili's. If you take pride in great team work, then we want to hear from you!
  • Fast hiring process

About Us

Chili's was born in Dallas, Texas in 1975. Since then, we've boldly claimed our place in the casual dining industry as the place to go for Big Mouth burgers, house smoked ribs, full on fajitas, and hand shaken margaritas! With a legacy deeply rooted in service, hospitality, and giving back, we are committed to delivering the best experience to every Guest, every day.

About You
  • Friendly, warm, and caring demeanor with Team Members

  • Ability to use slicers, mixers, grinders, food processors, etc.
  • Prior experience preferred in a similar food and beverage service and preparation position
Required

Preferred

title: First Shift - Welder And Fitter
description:
We are currently hiring a first shift Welder/Fitter Trainee. If you are interested apply now! Below is a job description:
  • Must be able to work safely in a production environment.
  • Assemble all phases of power unit, construction using a bill of material, arrangement drawing and schematic. (Use of hand tools such as tape measure, pneumatic tools and metal cutting equipment required.)
  • Finish weld pipe joints and structural assemblies per established welding codes using various welding processes such as GTAW, GMAW, SMAW and FCAW.
  • Work independently with minimal supervision according to standard shop guidelines.
  • Maintain a clean work area
  • Will work in an industrial environment and around large machinery
  • Proper safety equipment is provided and must be worn at all times.
  • Overtime may be requested.
  • Perform other essential and related peripheral duties as may be assigned.
  • Requirements:*
  • High school graduate plus vocational/technical training in welding field/trade.
  • One to two years prior welding and assembly experience required in related field.
  • Previous pipe welding experience preferred.
  • Good communication skills both verbal and written. Must demonstrate the ability to listen carefully, follow directions accurately, and complete work assignments in a timely manner.
  • Able to read drawings and schematics.
  • Demonstrated competency at welding and assembling systems.
  • Capable of passing welder qualification test.
  • Able to lift up to 50 lbs.
  • Ability to develop proper welding techniques.
  • Shift:* First shift!!

title: Engenheiro de Perfuração
description:
Descricão da Vaga:Executar a elaboração de Projetos Especializados de Perfuração de Poços. Formação:Profissional com nível Superior completo em Engenharia, com registro ATIVO no CREA. Experiência comprovada na área de poços de petróleo offshore, nas atividades de operação ou projetos de Perfuração direcional. Experiência em Competência de Dados: tratamento, transferência, coleta, organização, agrupamento, noções de análise estatística, árvore de decisão;Conhecimento em Power BI: Noções, filtros, organização dos dados, pesquisa. Operação básica com dados;Pacote de aplicativos MSOffice (Excel, Access, Word, PowerPoint);Noções de projeto de poço marítimo;Noções de construção de poço direcional, vertical e horizontal como operador e como projetista: premissas básicas de projetos, limitações e boas práticas em projetos e execução;Noções de equipamentos de sondas de perfuração;Noções de conceitos básicos de perfuração direcional;Conhecimento de ferramentas direcionais: motores de fundo, rotary sterable e turbinas de perfuração (seleção, limites operacionais, vantagens e desvantagens e operação);Noções de ferramentas de mapeamento de poço: MWD, GWD, Gyro; Noções de ferramentas de perfilagem: LWD e ferramentas a cabo. Limites e operação (poço aberto e poço revestido);Influência do direcional nas descidas a cabo por gravidade; Noções de projeto de BHA: tubulares, alargadores, escareadores, percussores de perfuração;Noções de operação e projeto utilizando sistemas de alargamento (alargadores, ferramentas de eliminação de offset broca x alargador em manobra única, estabilização no poço alargado etc..);Noções de simulação: torque e drag, hidráulica de poço e desgaste de revestimento;Noções de brocas de perfuração: seleção e cálculo de hidráulica;Noções de hidráulica de poço: correlação entre limpeza de poço e geometria de trajetória;Noções de segurança de poço e análise anticolisão entre poços;Noções de geologia e geodésia;Noções de orçamentação de poços;Noções de operação e projeto de testemunhagem;Noções de operações e projeto de canhoneio;Noções de operações e projeto de MPD;Noções básicas dos tipos de completação (contenção de areia, completações simples e inteligentes, etc);Noções básicas sobre cimentação, recimentação e correção da cimentação;Aplicação do canhoneio nos diferentes tipos de completação (cargas e densidades);Noções básicas de workover e de abandono;Noções básicas de caracterização de reservatório (geologia, geofísica e avaliação de reservatórios).

CLT (Efetivo)

title: コントラクトMR／業界未経験可／接客または営業経験者募集
description:
【企業名】 シミック・アッシュフィールド株式会社 【職種名】 コントラクトMR／業界未経験可／接客または営業経験者募集 【記事要約１】 営業・販売、接客経験が活かせる／業界未経験者活躍中 【記事要約２】 研修充実／MR認定資格取得を全面サポート 【記事要約３】 充実の福利厚生制度／東証プライム上場のグループ企業 【仕事内容(概要)】 営業・販売、接客で培った経験を活かし、未経験からコントラクトMRへ！ 【具体的な仕事内容】 ■MR：医薬品の品質・有効性・安全性等の情報提供や適性な使用と普及を推進／マーケティング・セールス等 コントラクトMRとは…クライアントである製薬企業の医薬品の情報提供活動や販売促進活動を行う CSO（Contract Sales Organization=医薬品販売業務受託機関）企業に所属し、活躍するMRのこと。 プロジェクトとは…クライアントである製薬企業との契約によって当社が担当する業務のこと。

■エリア内の病院、開業医、薬局を担当。

定期訪問施設数は40～50軒、1日あたり8～10施設を訪問いたします。 ■コントラクトMR 1日のスケジュール例 ※開業医担当の場合 8：00

複数の特約店（卸）を訪問 情報提供・情報収集 10：00 営業所へ出社 資料作成など 12：00 昼の休診時間帯に複数の医院を訪問 14：00 昼食 その日のスケジュールにより自分で調整 15：00 医療施設を訪問 製品説明会の実施など

薬局を訪問して薬剤師へ安全性情報を提供したり特約店へ訪問することも 20：00 営業所に帰社※自宅直帰の場合もあり ■仕事の魅力 MRは医薬情報担当者として人の生命に関わりを持つ仕事。医療従事者等に適切な情報提供を行うことが、その先の患者さんの命を救うことにつながっています。社会貢献度が高く、「誰かの役に立てている」というやりがいとステータスにともなう収入UPが見込める魅力的な仕事です。 【チーム・組織構成】 ■社風

当社ではMRの視点を重視し、働きやすい環境作りや新規ビジネスの検討を行っております。現場で活躍するMRで構成するタスクフォースチームの起案により実現に至った制度も多数。 社員一人ひとりの声を大切にする社風が根付いており、女性の活躍を支援するための制度として、育児支援、子の看護休暇など制度も充実しています。 また「結果」だけではなく、「行動プロセス」も評価。表彰するプログラムも導入しています。 【チーム・組織構成 組織名称】 CSO事業部門 【対象となる方(概要)】 ■大卒以上■要普免■営業・販売、接客の仕事経験2年以上※業界未経験者歓迎 【対象となる方(詳細)】 【求める人材】

◇以下いずれかのご経験をお持ちの方（目安2年以上）歓迎 ※業種未経験歓迎
  • 営業・販売：メーカー、不動産自動車、金融、人材、アパレル業界経験
  • 医療業界：看護師、薬剤師、臨床検査技師、放射線技師 など
  • ブライダル業界：コーディネーター、コンサルタント など
  • 旅行・ホテル業界：ホテルフロント、添乗員 など
  • 航空業界：客室添乗員（CA）、グランドスタッフ、グランドハンドリング など
  • その他：保育士、消防士、警察官、自衛官 など 【勤務地】 全国各エリア 1.全国どのエリアでも配属OK！ ※全国転勤が可能な場合は入社時一時金を支給 2.東日本ブロック（北海道・東北・北陸・甲信越・関東）内のどのエリアでも配属OK 3.西日本ブロック（東海・関西・中国・四国・九州・沖縄）内のどのエリアでも配属OK 上記2.3にあてはまらない場合もあるかと思いますが、面接の際に是非ご相談ください。 ■本社：東京都港区芝浦1-1-1 浜松町ビルディング 【本社へのアクセス】
・JR 山手線・京浜東北線「浜松町駅」南口S1（連絡通路）より徒歩7分

・都営地下鉄 大江戸線・浅草線「大門駅」B2出口（連絡通路）より徒歩12分

インプット研修では、薬学の基礎や各疾病と治療法をはじめ医薬品概論や振り返りテストなどで知識を習得。アウトプット研修については、ロールプレイング・プレゼンテーション研修などを実施。

あなたのチャレンジを全面的にサポートします。 【分類】 会社・事業の優位性は？ 【見出し】 身につくスキル・キャリアパス 【本文】 シミック・アッシュフィールドは直接的に医療従事者に対面するリアルチャネルとWebや電話などの媒体を通じてコミュニケーションするリモートチャネルの利点を前例にとらわれることなく柔軟に組み合わせることでクライアントである製薬企業に高付加価値を提供することができるマルチチャネルCSOを実践しています。 【やりがい】 全国で大手製薬企業のプロジェクトを多数獲得。このプロジェクトの多さはMRの満足度が高い理由の一つ。多くのプロジェクトを経験する事により新薬をはじめ後発品、長期収載品など多くの医薬品知識を獲得。MRとしてスキル向上、キャリアアップが可能です。 【きびしさ】 コントラクトMRはプライマリーからスペシャリティ領域まで様々な製薬企業の製品を取り扱う為、どのプロジェクトでも成果に繋げる事が出来るスキルを必要とします。より早い成果の発揮が求められます。 【事業概要】 ・製薬企業へのコマーシャル・ソリューション、マーケティングサポートの提供 ・コントラクトMR事業 ・メディカルアフェアーズ事業 ・コンタクトセンター事業 ■公益財団法人MR認定センターの認定企業 ■認定番号 ・MR-S第45号（システム認定） ・MR-E第10号（施設認定） ・一般労働者派遣事業許可 派13-304893 ・有料職業紹介事業 許可番号：13-ユ-302513 【郵便番号】 1050023 【所在地】 東京都港区芝浦1-1-1 【設立年 数値】 2000年 【設立年 補足】 8月（2014年10月商号変更） 【代表者】 社長執行役員 木﨑 弘 【従業員数】 800名（2021年7月30日現在） 【資本金】 5,500万円 【売上高】 760億9800万円（2020年9月期、シミックグループ連結） 【平均年齢】 30代 【HPリンク先】 http://www.cmic-ashfield.com/

title: Data Scientist
description:
Position Title: Data Scientist
Work Location: Remote
Duration : Long-Term
Summary: We are looking for a Data Scientist to join our client’s team and to be part of the data insights journey. Additionally, this person will help drive the technological exploration of Machine Learning and related technologies to address current and future business opportunities. This person must have strong experience using a variety of data mining/ analysis methods, using a variety of data tools, building, and implementing models, using/creating algorithms, and creating/running simulations. They must have a proven ability to drive business results with their data-based insights. They must be comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams. The right candidate will have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes.
Responsibilities:
· Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets.
· Work with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions.
· Mine and analyze company and external datasets to drive predictions, micro, macro economical and regulatory trends.
· Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data wrangling techniques.
· Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy..
Supervisory Responsibilities: No expectations of supervisory responsibility to begin with; however, this role will have multiple leadership opportunities over time – as such, candidates must be able to mentor and teach.
Required Skills:
· 2-5 years of data science experience using machine learning
· Experience in data monetization projects.
· Experience in economic and/or regulated business domains preferred.
· Experience in solving complex real world problems (focus on economics, and regulatory industries) using advanced analytics, statistical analysis, machine learning, and algorithms that drive value realization.
· Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SQL, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets.
· Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks.
· Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications.
· A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques
· Strong understanding of ML cloud services and infrastructure, including how to leverage them and experience with SaaS infrastructure technologies (AWS preferred)
· Ability to quickly assimilate, organize, analyze, abstract, and synthesize large amounts of information and to make decisions based on this analysis
Education: Master’s degree (MS) in computer science or equivalent experience is required.

title: Security Officer
description:
• Overview* Bakersfield Memorial Hospital is a 426 bed acute care medical center offering a full range of services including the Sarvanand Heart and Brain Center, Grossman Burn Center at Memorial Hospital, expanded maternity and family care, the Lauren Small Children’s Center, orthopedic services, wound care center, 24-hour emergency care and general/outpatient surgery. Memorial Hospital is a Children’s Miracle Network Hospital and is home to the Bakersfield Ronald McDonald House. Memorial Hospital is a member of Dignity Health and is a trusted community partner, serving residents of Bakersfield and Kern County with quality, compassionate care since 1956. Learn more by visiting [Bakersfield Memorial Hospital](https://www.dignityhealth.org/central-california/locations/memorial-hospital).
  • Responsibilities* The Security Officer is expected to provide a reasonably safe and secure environment for all who enter Dignity Health properties and to assure the physical security of buildings and grounds.
It is expected that the security officer will demonstrate behavior consistent with Dignity Health core value and humankindness.

Responsibilities Include

The security officer shall support Dignity Health’s strategic plan and the goals and direction of the quality improvement/process improvement activities.
  • Protecting staff, patients, and visitors by responding to calls for assistance in a timely and prudent manner such as violent or unruly patients, visitors, crimes committed or in progress, opening doors, and responding to emergency codes.
  • Patrol the facility and grounds by foot or vehicle; monitor security alarms and dispatch officers promptly to location(s) where needed, and report unsafe acts or conditions.
  • Knowledge of emergency procedures, equipment, supplies, reports HIPPA breaches if witnessed; investigate security breaches, conduct follow-up investigations, and write incident reports.
  • Log all activities in a daily log to accurately record events; and (2) complete clear, concise, and legible reports in a timely manner; use appropriate emergency and radio codes in dispatching security officers while knowing hospital campus to ensure that those dispatched are to right location.
#HelloSecurityOfficer security, officer, gua
  • Qualifications*
  • Minimum Qualifications*
  • Six (6) months experience as a security officer in a hospital or healthcare setting, prior law enforcement or military service; or one (1) year experience as a security officer.
  • High school diploma or equivalent; or three (3) years’ experience as a security officer.
  • Current state issued security officer license, showing no disciplinary actions
  • Workplace violence training annually.
  • Must be able to speak English, communicate clearly orally, and in writing; understand and use de-escalation techniques.
  • American Heart Association CPR/BLS Certification within 90 days of hire.
  • Preferred Qualifications *
  • Current driver’s license issued by the state wherein the position is posted with satisfactory DMV report on file or the ability to obtain one within 30 days of hire
  • Completion of IAHSS Basic Training for Healthcare Security Officer within 90 days

title: Engenheiro/Orçamentista
description:

Fazer o briefing com o setor de licitação sobre os custos x lucros. analise de comparação de custos, solicitar a aprovação da diretoria com o acompanhamento de licitação sobre as composições. Realizar um checklists para a realização das vistorias técnicas das obras, para realizar o levantamento dos dados para elaboração e composição dos orçamentos, propostas, cotações de preços, composições e insumos e serviço no setor publico e privado. Curso Superior em Arquitetura/ engenharia Civil, Urbanismo ou Técnico em Edificações. Possuir experiência em orçamento na área de construção civil (materiais hidráulicos e elétricos). Expertise em cronograma físicos e financeiros. Ter atuado no segmento de construção civil realizando levantamento, analise de projetos, custo de materiais e serviços de empreitada e todo o serviço necessário para a execução da obra. conhecimento em MS Project (cronograma e histograma), Auto Cad avançado. Possuir Excel avançado ( formulas e macro). conhecimento em matemática intermediaria. Desejável: conhecimento no sistema UAU.

Ter fácil acesso a Casa Verde - Zona Norte SP. Disponibilidade para viagens. Ser habilitado. Desejável ter carro próprio.

title: Senior Business Intelligence Engineer
description:
Are you a tech professional looking for remote work in a global setting? If yes, this job is for you.

Welcome to EPAM Anywhere - a global job platform offering remote work opportunities in the technology sector. Join us to build a career around your lifestyle working on modern projects for global brands and exciting startups.

We are currently looking for a remote Senior Business Intelligence Engineer with background in data warehouse design and data mining to join our team.

Responsibilities
  • Maintain and support data analytics platforms
  • Build new data products
  • Evaluate and improve existing BI systems using engineering best practices
  • Collaborate with teams to integrate systems
  • Develop and execute database queries

Requirements
  • 3+ years of proven experience as a BI developer
  • Background in data warehouse design (e.g. dimensional modeling) and data mining
  • Understanding of database management systems, ETL (extract, transform, load) approach
  • Knowledge of T-SQL (querying, store procedures)
  • Proven abilities to take initiative and be innovative
  • Analytical mind with a problem-solving aptitude
  • Proficient English (written and spoken) B2

Nice to have
  • Experience with SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) and SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS)

We offer
  • Paid time off
  • Paid sick leave days
  • Medical insurance
  • Stable income
  • 100% remote work forever
  • Free licensed software
  • Possibility to work on your own device (BYOD)
  • Stable workload
  • Relocation opportunities
  • Flexible engagement models
  • Free trainings for technical and soft skills
  • Free access to LinkedIn Learning platform
  • Language courses
  • Free access to internal and external e-Libraries
  • Certification opportunities
  • Skill advisory service

This is a remote position and we welcome applications from anywhere in Georgia

Once you apply, you'll receive a confirmation email with a link to EPAM Anywhere platform. Sign up with this link to automate your prescreening, be able to monitor your application statuses, and enjoy a faster job application process.

Please note that even though you are applying for this position, you may be offered other projects to join within EPAM Anywhere.

EPAM Anywhere is a part of EPAM Systems, Inc. (NYSE: EPAM). Since 1993, EPAM has leveraged its advanced software engineering heritage to become the foremost global digital transformation services provider.

title: Call Handler
description:
Are you a Call Handler looking for your next move?My client is recruiting for an experienced Call Handler to join their professional, friendly and caring team based in Hull amend as necessary. They are one of the leading providers of NHS eye patient services and, in 2018 they became the largest NHS cataract surgery provider in the UK. They believe in giving people the best advice to help improve their vision, providing a high standard of care to each of their patients.As a Patient Services Advisor for the company you will be responsible for resolving all customer queries to a high satisfaction. You will provide advice and guidance for patients on the services we provide whilst booking appointments and answering any clinical enquiries from patients, opticians and GP's. Ensuring the customer at the heart of everything you do will be key and putting forward any ideas for the continual improvement of the customer experience.Site Location: Hull HU10 6FEOur Patient Services Advisor package includes:
  • £20,000 - £20,723 per annum (salary in line with training and reviews)
  • We offer a work life balance shift between the hours of 8-6 Monday to Friday with a 1 in 5 Saturdays required.
  • 20 days holiday (28 days including bank holidays) increasing with length of service.
  • Bonus 1 - June - potential to earn up to 5% individual performance related bonus.
  • Bonus 2 - February - potential to earn up to 5% hospital/company related bonus.
  • Easily accessible by public transport and car.
  • Staff benefits including discounts at a large selection of retailers/hospitality.
  • Continuous training and development programme through our internal learning management system and clinical training team to help enhance your skills.
  • Referral programme - a cash reward of £350 for introducing new employees to the company.
  • Length of service rewards.
  • Career opportunities and progression within the business, our training team are on hand to help grow and develop your career.
Key Tasks
  • Ensure an exceptional customer experience for our callers by swiftly and accurately responding to and resolving all caller's requests and queries across a number of communication channels - inbound / outbound calls and email.
  • Provide support on a rotational basis for the administration function within the department.
  • To have knowledge of all procedures carried out by the company.
  • Act as a liaison with the clinical team in providing advice to post-operative enquiries.
  • Accurately maintaining and updating patient records on the patient management system, with every patient contact made.
  • You will be motivated and driven to meet your KPI's. Your individual performance will be the key contribution to the department achieving and exceeding all targets for quality and productivity.
  • Participate in regular 121s and team meetings with your manager.
  • Be a role model to the team by demonstrating outstanding positive behaviours and performance.
  • Comply with all inhouse Health and Safety procedures.
  • Adhere to all policies and procedures.
To be considered for this Call Centre role you must hold at least 12-month experience of working in a contact centre environment.#CPProffesional#CPProject300

The Recruitment Co. is an equal opportunities employer and we're committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace.

title: Nurse (LPN) PRN - Float Team
description:
The Volunteers of America National Services Minnesota Float Team is looking for an experienced Licensed Practical Nurse who wants to set their own schedule and work in the Minneapolis/St. Paul area! You can work a minimum of 4 shifts per month, up to full time hours. It's up to you!

We offer great wages ($30.00-32.00/hr!) and the flexibility of setting your own schedule at one or more of our facilities, based on shift availability, combined with the benefits of being a part of the Volunteers of America family. You will be assigned to work in any of our facilities located in Anoka, Minnetonka, Coon Rapids, Rochester, Sleepy Eye, and Maplewood.

This is a PRN/On Call position.

MN float team nurses must be willing to work at any of our Minnesota locations, Skilled Nursing, Assisted Living, Home Care, Affordable Housing, that has a need.

Our person centered care approach provides a low nurse to patient ratio, which allows you to make a real difference in the lives of those in your community. You will truly provide exceptional cares and clinical outcomes to your residents.

Core Responsibilities
  • Role models positive & open communication skills with all staff, customers, guests, residents and families.
  • Follows all shift routines, policy and procedures regarding monitoring of vital signs, weights, administration of medications and treatments.
  • Immediately reports any suspected abuse or neglect per facility policy.
  • Accurately utilizes electronic systems of documentation as required per facility policy.
Work where you feel safe.

During the National Public Health Emergency caused by the COVID-19 Pandemic, do you want to work in one of the safest environments possible? A place where the people you serve average 85% fully vaccinated? A place where your co-workers will also be fully vaccinated? Recently, the Healthcare division of Volunteers of America National Services decided to require vaccination for all employees, volunteers and contractors. While this decision was difficult, we understand that we care for individuals who are most susceptible to advanced COVID illness and death. We are committed to providing the safest environment possible for those we serve. This commitment extends to another very important group of individuals, our employees.

Join us today in providing care and services to older adults in an organization that cares deeply about the health and well-being of others; those we care for, our employees, our community and our Nation.

Work where you feel at home.

The warm and caring atmosphere of our communities is created by nurses, environmental specialists, certified nursing assistants and other team members who love to help older adults feel healthy and at home.

At Volunteers of America, we’re also dedicated to creating thoughtful, caring and flexible work environments for our team members. When you begin a career with us, expect the support you need to succeed in your role, respect for your individuality and beliefs, and opportunities for personal and professional development.

When you join our team of exceptional professionals, we’ll trust you to do your best each day, and to show compassion and caring for our residents and your fellow team members. In return, you’ll be rewarded with a generous array of industry-leading benefits and workplace considerations.

Special Features
  • Growth and advancement opportunities
  • Flexible schedules
  • Career scholarships
  • Quality training, continuing career education and leadership programs
  • Employee discount program
Job Requirements

Required Qualifications:
  • Graduate from an accredited school of nursing with current licensure as a Licensed Practical Nurse in the state of practice.
  • Maintain a current CPR Certification
  • Effective communicator with staff, families and outside agencies.
  • Ability to prioritize duties.
  • Customer service oriented with knowledge of successful customer service techniques.
  • Ability to understand residents’ charts, doctor’s orders, residents’ plan of care, medication orders.
  • Must possess the ability to effectively gather clinical data in regards to resident status and condition.
  • Ability to utilize computers and other electronic devices for tasks such as timekeeping, in-servicing and documentation.
  • Maintain IV Certification if required in the state of practice.
  • Understanding of current Antibiotic Stewardship, Infection Prevention & Infection Control and OSHA guidelines.
Preferred Qualifications
  • Long term care experience
At VOANS, we celebrate sharing, encouraging and embracing diversity. Equal employment opportunities are available to all without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, national origin, age, physical and mental disability, marital status, parental status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, military and veteran status, and any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We believe that blending individual strengths and unique personal differences nurtures and supports our organizations’ shared commitment to our mission and creates an inclusive and diverse environment where everyone feels valued and has the opportunity to do their personal best. #VOANS

Apply today and see why our employees have voted us a Great Place to Work four years in a row!
