title: Junior C# .NET Developer | Maastricht
description:
Vacature: Junior C# .NET Developer

Over KIOTA

Wij zijn KIOTA. Specialisten in consultancy van IT en Accounting & Control. Wij willen het beter doen dan de rest. Dit doen we o.a. door sterke kernwaardes te hanteren, zoals kwaliteit, persoonlijk, innovatie en agile. Wij geloven niet in “gaat niet”. Gaat niet bestaat niet, no can’t do. Onze relaties zetten wij centraal, daarmee maximaliseren we onze klantgerichtheid, of het nu gaat om kandidaten of klanten.

Onze processen zijn zo ingericht dat we in staat zijn om op een snelle en effectieve manier te werken. Tijd kost immers geld. Het resultaat staat bij ons op 1. Dingen die geen toegevoegde waarden hebben doen wij niet.

We hebben een duidelijk doel voor ogen: onze medewerkers laten groeien en excelleren in hun vak door ons te verdiepen in wat hen drijft. KIOTA beschikt over unieke kennis van deze vakgebieden en een uitgebreid netwerk van topwerkgevers.

Ben jij een gedreven professional?

De Uitdaging

Wil je graag in een Agile scrum team werken? Word je enthousiast als je verbeteringen en nieuwe functies kunt bouwen in de software? Wil je graag betrokken zijn bij het gehele ontwikkelproces, vanaf het ontwerpen van het technisch design tot de implementatie en uitrol van de software?

Kan je hier volmondig ‘ja’ op antwoorden, dan ben jij de geschikte kandidaat ter versterking van ons team.

Je ontwikkelt graag topkwaliteit software die voldoet aan de hoge verwachtingen en eisen van de klanten en je bent op de hoogte van de meest recente ontwikkelingen op het vlak van web technologie en deelt deze kennis graag met je collega’s. Je bent gemotiveerd, flexibel, resultaat gedreven, een teamplayer met uitstekende sociale en communicatieve vaardigheden en weet uitstekend om te gaan met onverwachte veranderingen.

Verder Heb Je
  • een afgeronde hbo of universitaire opleiding (met affiniteit voor software ontwikkeling)
  • minimaal 1 jaar ervaring als C# Developer
  • een goede beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal, zowel in woord als geschrift
  • basiskennis van: C#, .NET, .NET Core, .NET MVC, Javascript, jQuery, JSON en HTML5
  • interesse in: Entity Framework, Agile, Scrum, Jira, Confluence, Restful API’s, MsSQL, MySQL, Postgres en Delphi
Wat wij bieden

Een omgeving die hard werken combineert met professionaliteit, resultaat, focus en FUN! Je mag deelnemen in een van de snelst groeiende bedrijven in Nederland. Je wordt facilitair ondersteund en krijgt de mogelijkheid om in de keukens te kijken van grote professionele organisaties. Verder bieden we je een goed basissalaris, een carrière pad een leaseauto en aanzienlijke bonussen.

Binnen de werkomgeving van KIOTA werk je zelfstandig binnen een team. Je wordt gecoacht en gemotiveerd om het beste uit je zelf te halen in een team van gedreven professionals.

Solliciteren?

Solliciteren kan door op “direct solliciteren” te drukken in de rechter kolom op deze pagina.

title: Senior Node.js Engineer (Remote)
description:
About Us

TribalScale is an innovation firm that brings organizations - from the startup to the enterprise - into the future. We build digital products, transform teams, and grow startups. We're headquartered in Toronto and have offices around the world. The future is bright, and we're always looking for excited technologists to create with us.
  • Some of the platforms that we work with:
  • Mobile & Web (iOS, Android)
  • Voice User Interfaces (Amazon Alexa, Google Home)
  • Connected Cars and Homes
  • OTT (Roku, Fire TV, Android TV, tvOS)
About You

You are excited about connecting the world and want to join a small team of ambitious technologists. You have a strong passion about building cool products and want to work somewhere where you're trusted from Day 1. You appreciate the sense of ownership and being recognized and rewarded properly for all the work that you have done. You also have the strong desire of working directly with the founders who have world class experience on developing products from the ground up and launching them into the market.

What You'll Do
  • Work remotely from home during the business hours of 9:00am-5:00pm EST
  • Engineer production-quality code to deploy these solutions on a platform specific for the client
  • Enhance testing platforms, improve test automation, foster software craftsmanship
  • Develop technical architecture and suggest the appropriate cloud services and frameworks to accomplish product goals
  • Surprise and delight customers and partner software engineers
  • Monitor and evaluate the performance of our solutions
Requirements

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS NEEDED:
  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field
  • 7+ years of experience in backend software development primarily with JavaScript and Node.js
  • 7+ years of experience with a variety of database technologies such as SQL and NoSQL
  • 5+ years of experience with deploying cloud-based software solutions with AWS
  • 3+ year of experience in Test Driven Development (TDD) and eXtreme Programming (XP) practices
Bonus Points For
  • Experience with Event Driven Architecture
  • Experience mentoring junior and intermediate engineers
  • Experience with messaging services such as Queueing and Pub/Sub
  • Experience working on client projects
  • Highly effective in working with other technical specialists, Product Managers, UI/UX Designers and business partners.
  • Capable in CI/CD tools and pipelines such as Harness, Jenkins, etc.
  • Strong oral and written communication skills.
  • Ability to multi-task and manage changing priorities.
  • Strong teamwork and interpersonal skills.
  • Ability to work independently and take initiative when solving unexpected problems.
  • Understanding of fundamental data modeling
  • Experience in development of micro-services.
WHY YOU WANT TO BE AT TRIBALSCALE
  • We are a collective of people and collaboration is key to our process.
  • We don't work for our clients, we work with them. We've helped ABC News, CBS Radio, the PGA Tour, CIBC, AAA, and more.
  • Our team led the mobile revolution and now, we're pushing the boundaries with emerging technology and we're transforming companies.
  • Everyone brings something valuable to the table and we empower each other to be a change-maker.
  • We live by our values, meritocracy, empowerment, and transparency, and we recognize that diversity is our strength.
  • Our mission is right the future and that's what we're doing, we're making a dent in how the world innovates.
Benefits

STAY HAPPY & HEALTHY
  • Health benefits: 100% medical, dental and vision coverage
  • Generous maternity and paternity leave policies
  • Office closed over Winter holidays
  • Birthday Off
  • Vetster - 4 FREE Vet Checkups per year for your furry family!
  • Class Pass Discount
  • GoodLife Membership Corporate Discount
  • Bike Share Program
  • Referral Bonus'
  • Inkblot mental health partnership with subsidized counseling benefits
  • Annual Professional Development budget
MAKE MEANINGFUL CONNECTIONS
  • Friday Demo's to show off your work
  • Remote Activities: online contests, movie nights, group fitness and more!
  • Social Events: Bonfires, casual drinks, sports nights and more!
  • Quarterly team events: axe-throwing, beach day, and more!
DIVERSITY

TribalScale is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, able-bodiedness or gender identity.

TribalScale welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities, age, citizenship, marital status, able-bodiedness or gender identity.

If you require accommodation for any reason, please let us know as we are more than happy to accommodate all.

title: Aftermarket SIOP & Materials Manager
description:
Role Purpose

As the Aftermarket SIOP & Materials Manager you will supervise a team of intermediate professionals, planning goals and objectives for the team in SIOP & Materials and will set the teams priorities.

In This Role You Will

As the Aftermarket SIOP & Materials Manager you will:
  • Apply AFM expertise and business knowledge to establish a robust AFM project plan, leading governance to accelerate the implementation of LEK recommendations.
  • Establish standard criteria and relevant KPIs (Delivery & Quality) for control & improvements of AFM SIOP performances & ensure activities are aligned to the overall Actuation objectives (High Priority from LEK)
  • Lead deployment of DHL tool / Skill Matrix across AFM organisation, support functional skills gaps assessment & plan to close gaps.
  • Responsible for coordinate with the sites & fulfil requirements coming from AFM Central Collins/Advance systems as well as Actuation Leadership (e.g. SIOP AFM Quarterly Maturity Assessment & Gap closing , AFM inclusion into L2 SIOP review.. )
  • Ensure standard policies & CMS procedures in SIOP & Materials Management are followed, ensure continuous improvement for AFM by maintaining synergies & integration with OE.
  • Accountable for Managing a team of specialist, set objectives and coordinate their activities to achieve results.
  • Driving continuous improvement opportunities and demand accuracy across Actuation sites
  • Drive development of new tools & process with ASA Analytics team

You Will Bring To This Role
  • Bachelor's degree (Business, Supply Chain, or Technical)
  • APICS CPIM/SCM certification (GLP)
  • A strong background within aftermarket
  • SAP/APO & dashboard analysis
  • Running/Setting up SIOP dashboard
  • Understanding of Finance, Programs Continuous improvement, Supply Chain, Logistics and Operations functions & ERP system
  • Self organising, manage time to meet deadlines & accomplish tasks
  • Ability to monitor progress and make changes as necessary

About Us

Collins Aerospace, a Raytheon Technologies company, is a leader in technologically advanced and intelligent solutions for the global aerospace and defense industry. Collins Aerospace has the capabilities, comprehensive portfolio and expertise to solve customers’ toughest problems and to meet the demands of a rapidly evolving global market.

The next chapter of our future as an aerospace company is here, and we are excited about what this means for our employees and customers! Get onboard the Collins Aerospace Operations team and play a part in managing our innovative products from inception to delivery. The Operations team continues to grow and aims to strengthen the connection of Manufacturing Operations, Supply Chain and Environment, Health & Safety (EH&S) across Collins Aerospace. In this dynamic environment, you will have the opportunity to network across our businesses and functions, all while improving the productivity, quality and efficiency of our operations worldwide.

Our benefits package includes a competitive base salary and car benefit, as well as 25 days annual leave + bank holidays, as well as private dental & healthcare. In addition, there is an Employee Assistance Programme, ability to buy and sell holidays, cycle to work scheme, employee discounts and a fantastic pension scheme.

Diversity drives innovation; inclusion drives success. Collins Aerospace is committed to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion because we believe that acknowledging and learning from people from many different backgrounds and interests creates an environment where everyone can be their best, ensuring that Collins can be its best. All welcome. All equal. All in.

Apply now and be part of the team that’s redefining aerospace, every day.

Please note that potential candidates will be subject to Baseline Personnel Security Standard (BPSS) and background checks and that project access restrictions may apply to some nationalities.

title: Production Generalist HPT Blades 2nd Shift
description:
Pratt & Whitney is working to once again transform the future of flight—designing, building and servicing engines unlike any the world has ever seen. And because transformation begins from within, we’re seeking the people to drive it. So, calling all curious.

Come ready to explore and you’ll find a place where your talent takes flight—beyond the borders of title, a country or your comfort zone. Bring your passion and commitment and we’ll welcome you into a tight-knit team that takes our mission personally. Channel your drive to make a difference into shaping an organization and an industry that’s evolving fast to the future.

Innovation through diversity of thought. At Pratt & Whitney, we believe diversity of thought enables creativity, innovation, and a foundation for inclusion. By fostering an inclusive culture, we accept a shared accountability and responsibility to recognize, sponsor, coach, hire and promote talent equally. We welcome our employees to be their whole - best - selves at work because trust, respect and integrity, are a part of our DNA.

At Pratt & Whitney, the difference you make is on display every day. Just look up. Are you ready to go beyond?

Key Responsibilities
  • Prepare a variety of surface prep and repair operations on aero-engine turbine airfoil components
  • May include grit blasting, masking, blending, and other routine task
  • Assist in the development of other team members.
  • Perform any aspect of this role in assigned area to improve personal development.
  • Perform unrelated duties as may be necessary to support the needs of the facility.
  • Perform job in compliance with all environmental, health, and safety rules, procedures and policies.
  • Foster and maintain Positive Relationships
  • Complete tasks at the highest level of safety awareness

Basic Qualifications
  • High school graduate or GED
  • U.S. Citizenship required due to government contracts or permanent resident status
  • 1 year of experience in a manufacturing environment

Preferred Qualifications
  • Ability to utilize precision measuring instruments (Vernier calipers, micrometers, etc.)
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite
  • Craft clear communication
  • Analytical Skills
  • Creative troubleshooting skills
  • Possess excellent judgement and professional maturity
  • Possess extraordinary people and social skills.

What is my role type?

This Role Is

In addition to transforming the future of flight, we are also transforming how and where we work. We’ve introduced role types to help you understand how you will operate in our blended work environment.

Onsite: Employees who are working in Onsite roles will work primarily onsite. This includes all production and maintenance workers, as they are essential to the development of our engines.

Candidates will learn more about role type and current site status throughout the recruiting process. For onsite and hybrid roles, commuting to and from the assigned site is the employee’s personal responsibility.

Pratt & Whitney in GRAND PRAIRIE, TX is a FAA regulated facility and as such under the U.S. Departments of Transportation’s Federal Aviation Administration (FAA). This position is considered safety sensitive in accordance with FAA Guidelines. Candidate will be subject to drug and alcohol testing per FAA’s regulation 14 CFR part 120, as well as 49 CFR part 40.

Raytheon Technologies is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age or any other federally protected class.

title: Project Manager - Historical Renovation
description:
• Work for one of Wisconsin's top design build firms|Lucrative opportunity to work on large high profile projects


About Our Client

Our client is a well-established design build commercial general contractor located near Milwaukee, Wisconsin. They have been in the industry for 50+ years and have been ranked among the best design build firms in the industry.

Job Description

The key responsibilities of the Project Manager:
  • Participating in Preconstruction deliverables including design requirements, constructability and material selections through submittal submission.
  • Participating in preparing detailed scopes of work, bidding out and scoping out selected subcontractors for execution of the work.
  • Help oversee construction scheduling, sequencing and production tracking throughout the project.
  • Work with Operations team in identifying issues as they arise and working with the design team and other trade partners to resolve.
  • Creating detailed estimates for operations and accounting, as well as, work with Accounting team for monthly payment applications.
  • Perform pricing of all changes throughout the project lifecycle by evaluating plan/drawing changes to set target value cost budget.
  • Assisting Operations team in procurement and scheduling of materials.
  • Perform Lead Reporting, Community Hiring and Diversity goals throughout the project.
  • Develop and manage relationship with our customer, trade partners and subcontractors
  • Perform quantity surveys from blue prints and Revit models to help prepare cost budgets.

MPI does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, or based on an individual's status in any group or class protected by applicable federal, state or local law. MPI encourages applications from minorities, women, the disabled, protected veterans and all other qualified applicants.

The Successful Applicant

The successful Project Manager
  • BS degree in Engineering, Construction Management, Architecture, or Project Management preferred
  • Design build experience required
  • Commercial construction estimating experience required
  • 5+ years of experience
What's on Offer

What is on offer for the successful Project Manager:
  • Comprehensive compensation package
  • Full health insurance package, plus PTO, paid holidays, 401k match, and profit sharing plan
  • Flexible work hours
  • Team bonding and charitable outings
  • Great culture, and a collaborative team
  • Opportunity for quick advancement internally
  • Unique opportunity to help grow a division of an established organization
Contact: Sean Naumann

title: Sr. Customer Success Manager, Retail
description:
We are excited to announce the role of Senior Customer Success Manager for our Polk Automotive Solutions business unit. This position is slated for U.S. coverage and will be partnered with our Retail Tier 3 Automotive team. The role will report directly to the Head of Customer Success for Polk Automotive Solutions.


Objectives: Become the primary steward for Retail leveraging Polk Automotive data, focusing on strategic account and campaign management. Subject matter expert for delivery, execution, campaign management, and troubleshooting of Polk Dealer Marketing platform.


PDM is a new and highly anticipated SAAS platform servicing the needs of the Tier 3 Automotive space. In this role, you will work closely with sales, Customer Success Managers, and clients, to ensure seamless delivery and timely response to client delivery questions and troubleshooting inquiries. You will be the technical and execution expert for delivery on the PDM platform.


Lead Customer Success Practice For Polk Automotive Solutions Retail


  • Become the product expert for services within your client base and consult with sales and customers to provide the best solution
  • Own campaign management, working closely with sales and Customer Success Delivery to achieve client goals
  • Take the lead on closed opportunities
  • Consolidate go-to-market materials for ease of access
  • On-board clients for our solutions
  • Develop standard data training materials for clients
  • Work closely with Customer Success Delivery to review workload and prioritize effectively across all deliverables in customer success queue
  • Demonstrate a deep understanding of Polk Automotive products and services to internal constituents as well as external clients and partners
  • Clearly communicate the progress of weekly/monthly/quarterly initiatives to internal and external stakeholders
  • Primary resource for technical on-boarding client for our PDM solutions
  • Ensure adoption of the platform aligns with internal & client goals
  • Consult with clients on execution strategy, platform usage, and technical troubleshooting
  • Run point with internal resources to solve issues with the platform, ensuring themes are communicated to product
  • Partner with product and production teams to ensure platform feedback is integrated into product enhancement roadmaps
  • Act as the expert for PDM delivery and execution functions


Collaborate Closely And Effectively With Polk Sales Teams


  • Work with sales & product to establish and strategize appropriate Polk solutions to meet immediate and long-term client needs
  • Assist in developing and standardizing client proposals
  • Create client business reviews
  • Monitor customer success metrics, providing recommendations for continual refinement to processes and materials


Your Role


Own all business operations for the existing book of business you will support - this includes working directly with internal resources and stakeholders, managing SalesForce opportunities, and driving solutions to completion with production and technical support teams.


The Polk Automotive Solutions Team Is Seeking


  • A partnership-driven individual who thrives on relationship-building to enable scaling and optimizing delivery of our solutions
  • A thorough and skilled communicator both internally and externally across various communication channels
  • A dynamic, thought-leading individual with a desire to “be the brand” and represent the business line with excitement
  • A strong collaborator who can work across functional teams, and bring together constituents from IHS Markit teams and partner organizations with ease


About You


  • 5+ years in customer success and/or account management in the advertising and marketing media, technology, or data industries
  • Strong knowledge of, and interest in, Automotive marketing landscape and Tier 3 Automotive
  • Preferred SAAS technical or operational experience
  • Strong written and verbal communications with an aptitude for presenting thoughts and ideas to all levels of internal and external stakeholders
  • Works to build consensus across groups with competing priorities
  • Persuasive with details and facts
  • Excellent computer skills and proficient in all Microsoft Office and Salesforce applications


About Us


At IHS Markit, we’re changing the way the world interacts with information. Our dynamic team consists of more than 15,000 analysts, data scientists, industry experts, and software developers serving 80% of the Fortune Global 500. IHS Markit (NYSE:INFO) is a world leader in critical information, analytics and solutions for the major industries and markets that drive economies worldwide. IHS Markit automotive experts partner closely with automotive OEMs, dealers, and affiliates to deliver industry-leading audience, measurement, and insights products. The Polk Automotive Solutions are built on the industry’s most comprehensive US vehicle databases, ensuring our capabilities span the entire car-buying lifecycle. We deliver a frictionless experience for our customers across all marketing and media channels including linear and advanced TV, digital, websites, social, out-of-home, direct mail, and email. Learn more at IHSMarkit.com/Polk.


Equal Opportunity Employer


S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.


If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to: EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person.


US Candidates Only


The EEO is the Law Poster http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf describes discrimination protections under federal law.

title: Software Tester
description:
Heb jij minimaal 3 jaar test automation ervaring en kan jij goed overweg met Selenium en Katalon? Dan ben ik op zoek naar jou!

Je gaat aan de slag bij een bedrijf dat actief is binnen de bouw -en infrasector. Het bedrijf is een leverancier van CAD/GIS oplossingen en is de grootste distributeur van Europa in Autodesk licenties. Daarnaast ontwerpt het bedrijf verschillende ontwerpsystemen voor de (ondergrondse) infra en de maak industrie. De Development afdeling werkt volgens een Agile/Scrum werkwijze en is continue bezig met innovatie. Het bedrijf is informeel en de werknemers communiceren in korte lijnen naar elkaar. Ter uitbreiding op het gebied van Testing is dit bedrijf op zoek naar een Software Tester.

Functie

Als Software Tester zal jij verantwoordelijk zijn voor het bepalen van test automation tools en het opstellen en bijhouden van documentatie. Je werkt samen met drie andere testers en jij zal dus veel sparren met de andere testers over de optimalisatie van het testing proces. Daarnaast zal jij jouw collega’s adviseren over de verbeteringen van de testing werkzaamheden.

Eisen

  • Je hebt een afgeronde HBO opleiding
  • Je hebt ervaring met Selenium
  • Ervaring met Katalon is een pré
  • Je bent analytisch en communicatief sterk

Aanbod

  • Een salaris tot € 4500
  • Vakantiegeld
  • 25 vakantiedagen
  • Een goede pensioensregeling
  • Een leuk team
  • Aanvullende verzekeringen
  • Een leuke en afwisselende job voor 32-40 uur

Ben jij klaar voor de volgende stap in jouw carrière? Solliciteer dan nu!

Voor meer informatie kan je contact opnemen met mij via 088-321 8 123 of [email protected]

title: Technisch planontwikkelaar
description:
Als technisch planontwikkelaar binnen dit bouwbedrijf behoren de volgende taken tot je functie:
  • Het verder (uit)ontwikkelen van projecten vanaf VO- of DO-fase tot een UO.
  • Het leiden en begeleiden van bouwteams.
  • Het ontwikkelen van projecten, als gedelegeerd ontwikkelaar in opdracht van derden.
  • Het aansturen van het “design-/engineeringsdeel” van UAV-GC-contracten.
  • Het verzorgen van vergunningsaanvragen en alle daarbij komende werkzaamheden.
  • Aansturen en begeleiden van tenderteams bij aanbestedingen en selecties.
  • Het opstellen en bewaken van planningen.
  • Het bewaken van en sturen op budgetten.
  • Het onderhouden en uitbreiden van contacten met (potentiële) opdrachtgevers.

De afdeling ontwikkeling bestaat uit een tweetal collega’s en een directeur ontwikkeling en acquisitie. De projecten, taken en hoeveelheid werk worden op basis van kwaliteiten, interesses en bezetting onderling verdeeld.

Als Technisch Planontwikkelaar Neem Je Mee
  • Tenminste 5 jaar aantoonbare relevante werkervaring, waarin je:
    • Sturing hebt gegeven aan projecten. Je bent in staat verder en breder te denken dan de gebaande paden. Creativiteit op bepaalde momenten wordt gewaardeerd.
    • Technisch bouwkundige kennis hebt gebruikt, toegepast en ontwikkeld
    • Hebt gewerkt met de laatste relevante wet- en regelgeving, rondom onder andere: Het Bouwbesluit, Wabo, Wro en BENG.
Opleiding Tenminste
  • HBO bouwkunde, bij voorkeur aangevuld met een commerciële cursus, of;
  • HBO technische bedrijfskunde, aangevuld met voldoende bouwtechnische ervaring;

Je bent proactief, werkt gestructureerd, kunt jezelf motiveren maar bent ook in staat een team te motiveren. Je bent communicatief sterk en beheerst de Nederlandse taal uitstekend in woord en geschrift en bent daarnaast de Engelse taal vaardig.

Organisatie- en afdelingsomschrijving

Ben jij een ervaren planontwikkelaar en wil jij werken in de utiliteits- en woningbouw, renovatie en onderhoud? Voor innovatieve projecten in de omgeving van Breda zijn wij opzoek naar een technisch planontwikkelaar. Je gaat aan de slag bij een bouwpartner die graag op een innovatieve en initiatiefrijke manier een bijdrage levert aan de realisatie en herstructurering van woon- en werkruimte. Hierbij combineren ze hun brede en bovenal deskundige kennis en jarenlange ervaring in de utiliteits- en woningbouw, renovatie en onderhoudsprojecten. De proactieve houding wordt alom gewaardeerd en juist in datgene, wat ze méér doen dan bouwen, schuilt hun meerwaarde. Hier werken veel collegiale en gemotiveerde mensen. Benieuwd of dit bedrijf bij jou past? Robert Voragen komt graag met je in contact. Je bereikt hem op 06 30 44 53 79 of stuur een mail naar rv@multiselect.nl.

Aanbod

Uiteraard hebben wij jou ook veel te bieden. Een uitdagende functie bij een bouwbedrijf in de omgeving van Den Bosch waar je met creativiteit, enthousiasme en resultaatgerichtheid veel kunt bereiken. Ze kennen uitstekende arbeidsvoorwaarden waaronder een passend salaris, ruime verlofregeling en een auto, laptop en telefoon van de zaak. Kortom een leuke job waar je echt iets kan veranderen en bijdragen. Er is daarnaast veel ruimte voor verdere persoonlijke groei en ontwikkeling. Klinkt dit als iets voor jou? We horen graag waarom jouw ambities en kwalificaties bij de onze passen.

title: MES项目经理
description: 该职位来源于猎聘 职责描述： 1、负责组建和管理项目实施团队，考核项目团队成员，编制项目实施计划； 2、负责项目实施过程中的质量、交期、成本控制； 3、负责协调项目内外部资源调度，并与顾客之间保持良好客户关系； 4、按规定及时诚实汇报项目实施进度，编制各种报告，及时录入项目管控系统； 5、负责数字工厂管理系统，包括MES/MOM/ERP系统、物流系统、质量系统、资源系统、采集系统等模块实施的项目过程管理； 6、协助销售向客户提供数字工厂系统的方案编制、系统演示等。 任职要求： 1、有良好的项目团队管理能力； 2、有高度的责任心与工作激情，有较强的工作抗压能力； 3、具备与顾客进行顺畅沟通的能力，有良好的语言表达技巧； 4、有较强的分析能力和文案能力，对现场生产制造管理、生产跟踪、质量管理、生产物流等有深刻理解，能根据客户、项目阶段需求编制完整的方案； 5、本科以上学历，五年以上相关工作经验，计算机、信息管理、自控、机械、生产管理、质量管理、工业自动化等相关专业优先； 6、有带领团队实施过制造业ERP，MES、MOM项目两个以上的完整实际经验； 7、可以适应经常性出差。

title: Home Care Workers - Expression of Interest
company_name: Gold Coast Hospital and Health Service
description:
For Further Information On Our Health Service, Please Watch Our Corporate Video

Experience everything the Gold Coast has to offer while working as a Home Care Worker, providing assistance to older people and their carers either in home or within the community setting throughout the Gold Coast region.

Gold Coast Health are seeking motivated Home Care Workers to join our Home Care and Allied Health Service, delivering a range of services to clients using a wellness and reablement approach.

The Home Care and Allied Health Service is funded by the Commonwealth Home Support Program to provide a range of flexible, entry level basic support services that assist clients to maintain independence in their own homes. Home Care is predominantly funded for domestic assistance. In this role you will assist clients to maintain the cleanliness of their homes and connection to community

Submit your Expression of Interest (EOI) for future Home Care Worker positions within Gold Coast Hospital and Health Service.

If deemed suitable, your details will remain in the Home Care Worker Talent Pool and you may be contacted at the time an opportunity arises.

About You

To be successful in this position you will require:
  • Aged care check
  • Driver licence and the use of a reliable class C vehicle
  • Mobile phone
  • Evidence of vaccination, or be able to be vaccinated against and remain vaccinated against - Measles, Mumps, Rubella, Varicella (Chicken Pox), Pertussis (Whooping Cough), Hepatitis B and COVID 19
  • Tuberculosis screening, to identify if the tuberculosis vaccination may be required
  • Declaration of serious discipline history must be disclosed
  • While not mandatory, a relevant certificate III qualification to provide personal care would be well regarded
Benefits
  • Flexible work options
  • Career Development
  • Salary Packaging
  • Modern Facilities
  • Diverse Work Culture
  • Research Opportunities
  • Up to 12.75% super
  • 17.5% leave loading
About Gold Coast Health
  • Nationally and internationally recognised location for innovative medical research and health care
  • Annual operating budget exceeding $1.5 billion
  • More than 1100 beds across three hospitals - Gold Coast University Hospital, Robina Hospital, Varsity Lakes Hospital and Robina and Southport Health Precincts
  • Secondary and tertiary health services across more than 20 facilities
  • Opportunity to combine professional advancement, job satisfaction and relaxation into one fulfilling lifestyle
Please Note

Submission of this EOI is not a guarantee that you will be offered employment with Gold Coast Hospital and Health Service.
  • Submission of this EOI is not a guarantee that you will be offered employment with Gold Coast Health.
  • By submitting an EOI, you will not automatically be considered for advertised vacancies. If you wish to be considered for a specific advertised vacancy, please ensure you submit your application for the relevant vacancy via SmartJobs.
Occupational group Community Care

title: Lab Technician
description:
Laboratories in Santa Clara looking for highly motivated, creative problem solvers who can be part of a team performing high throughput genotyping, DNA copy number, and DNA extraction. This job requires a dedicated individual, who is a quick learner and enjoys challenges.
  • How you will make an impact:* We provide customers with service offerings for microarray genotyping, gene expression and Next Gen Genotyping platforms using sequencing technologies. We provide customers with an opportunity to test our platforms and prove their efficacy. We have both internal and external customers from both industry and academia worldwide studying a large variety of subjects and organisms.
  • What you will do:*
  • We have multiple lab environments in our organization and you might work in any of four environments.
  • Do genotyping assays such requiring use of multi-channel pipettes, reagent preparation and sample tracking. Perform high throughput genotyping using automated liquid handlers and timed schedules. Provide assistance in the pre-PCR lab environment performing quantitation and normalization of nucleic acids utilizing automation. Work in a BSL2 space for nucleic acid extractions Other general laboratory duties include
  • Enter data into LIMS.
  • Report any out-of-calibration or broken equipment.
  • Fill out inventory sheets for material consumed
  • Assist team in stocking/restocking materials and shipping/receiving customer samples.
  • How will you get here? *
  • BS in biological sciences fields, such as Biology or Biochemistry with 1-2 years laboratory experience in basic laboratory techniques required such as micropipetting, solution preparation, PCR, gel electrophoresis, optical density measurements, work with Laboratory Information Management System (LIMS).
  • Knowledge, Skills, Abilities:*
  • Work well in a team environment
  • Proven excellent record keeping and organizational skills
  • Self-motivated
  • Capacity to learn new technologies/concepts rapidly and apply them to the needs of the lab
  • Flexibility to occasionally work on weekends

About Actalent:

Actalent connects passion with purpose. Our scalable talent solutions and services capabilities drive value and results and provide the expertise to help our customers achieve more. title: MJ000221项目经理/主管
description:
职位来源于智联招聘。

岗位职责
  • 负责收集并汇总项目干系人的需求，制定项目目标；组织分析项目资源需求，制定项目计划；
  • 管理和监控项目的范围、进度、成本、质量，保证项目目标的达成；
  • 项目实施过程定期对风险进行识别和评估，制定风险应对措施；实时对问题进行记录，并制定解决计划，跟踪计划实施过程及结果；
  • 对接市场、研发等其它部门的需求变更，及时进行变更影响分析及变更实施及控制；
  • 按照质量体系要求组织完成开发过程技术评审、文档输出、阶段评审，保障项目实施过程质量；
  • 定期对所有项目问题进行复盘，提供反馈意见，同时形成项目知识文档，并进行内部知识共享，提升团队专业素质；
  • 项目团队的日常管理，对项目进行统筹规划，组织项目日常会议，输出项目周报及阶段性进展汇报。
任职要求

  • 五年以上产品开发经验，两年以上项目管理工作经验，有医疗器械（分子诊断）行业工作经验者优先；
  • 掌握项目管理知识体系，能熟练使用常用的项目管理工具；
  • 具有优秀的沟通协调能力、组织能力，善于团队协作；
  • 思路清晰，思维敏捷，具有优秀的学习能力和逻辑分析能力；
  • 具有PMP或其它相关证书者优先。

title: (100% ON SITE) Entry Level CSR/DATA ENTRY
description:
• EARLY COLLECTIONS REPS (ECARS)*
  • Contact customers 5-29 days past due on car payment(s) and work to resolve delinquency. (100+ outbound calls daily).
  • Use customer service skills to determine customer’s reason for delinquency and offer appropriate solution based on customer’s situation
  • Negotiate payment arrangements on past due accounts
  • Conduct minimal skip tracing necessary to prepare account for next level of collections (more of a customer service reminder call on a late payment than hard core skip tracing)
  • CUSTOMER SERVICE REPS*
  • Consistently answer incoming calls to the Customer Service Department (approx. 60+ phone calls daily).
  • Ask appropriate questions to identify the root cause of calls to generate effective solutions for customers while effectively resolving conflicts.
  • Follow up on customer issues and concerns (payments, payoffs, title work) in a timely manner.
  • Use time management skills to balance the quantity and quality of calls made and received as well as meeting deadlines for any assigned projects
  • Additional Skills & Qualifications:*
  • MUST HAVE*
  • Call Center (OR Bachelor's)
  • High Call Volume
  • NICE TO HAVE*
  • Associates or Bachelor's Degree
  • Collections
  • Bilingual (Spanish, Korean, or Mandarin)
  • Negotiations

About Aston Carter:

At Aston Carter, we’re dedicated to expanding career opportunities for the skilled professionals who power our business. Our success is driven by the talented, motivated people who join our team across a range of positions – from recruiting, sales and delivery to corporate roles. As part of our team, employees have the opportunity for long-term career success, where hard work is rewarded and the potential for growth is limitless. Established in 1997, Aston Carter is a leading staffing and consulting firm, providing high-caliber talent and premium services to more than 7,000 companies across North America. Spanning four continents and more than 200 offices, we extend our clients’ capabilities by seeking solvers and delivering solutions to address today’s workforce challenges. For organizations looking for innovative solutions shaped by critical-thinking professionals, visit [AstonCarter.com.](AstonCarter.com) Aston Carter is a company within Allegis Group, a global leader in talent solutions. The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law. If you would like to request a reasonable accommodation, such as the modification or adjustment of the job application process or interviewing process due to a disability, please call 888-237-6835 or email [astoncarteraccommodation@astoncarter.com](mailto:%20astoncarteraccommodation@astoncarter.com) for other accommodation options. However, if you have questions about this position, please contact the Recruiter located at the bottom of the job posting. The Recruiter is the sole point of contact for questions about this position.

title: Manufacturing Engineer I (Onsite, Mobile, AL)
description:
Collins Aerospace is looking for Manufacturing Engineer I to perform a wide range of tasks and services to support the manufacturing critical technologies for the world's largest aviation customer.

In this role, you will devise, design, and implement advanced solutions supporting quality, costs, production, and business unit objectives. The hired professional should demonstrate theoretical and practical knowledge of manufacturing equipment and systems and be able to work autonomously with limited supervision utilizing honed root cause analysis skills in troubleshooting and developing countermeasures and corrective actions.
  • Please note that this position will be onsite at our customer's facility in Mobile, AL. Engineer will work on-call, and be available to work nights and weekends to support business needs. Relocation is available for the eligible selected candidate.*

Responsibilities
  • Investigate and provide solutions related to nacelle and aircraft engine assembly and installations.
  • Oversee technology delivery, pre and post installation testing, rework, component replacement, and flight line operations.
  • Will be responsible for engine and nacelle offloads, troubleshooting, harness and valve changes, parts changes, and correcting part defects.
  • Develop, implement, and improve real time data collection and analysis. Seek and implement solutions to improve producibility and process capability based on data.
  • Prepare hardware and technologies for testing and qualification of systems.
  • Assist test teams with test schedules and execution.
  • Support assembly and testing of electrical power, wheels, and brake systems.

Basic Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree (typically in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM)) and a minimum of 2 years of prior relevant experience unless prohibited by local laws/regulations. OR
  • In absence of a degree, 6 years of relevant experience is required.
  • Must be a U.S. Person/Permanent Resident “Green Card” holder.

Desired Qualifications
  • Experience in engine or nacelle systems, aircraft flight line operations, or flight testing.
  • Knowledge of propulsion systems or aviation/aerospace operational experience highly desire.
  • Experienced in work order creation.
  • Knowledge of CAD design software is desired.

Collins Aerospace, a Raytheon Technologies company, is a leader in technologically advanced and intelligent solutions for the global aerospace and defense industry. Collins Aerospace has the capabilities, comprehensive portfolio and expertise to solve customers’ toughest challenges and to meet the demands of a rapidly evolving global market.

Our Advanced Structures team leverages advanced materials and additive manufacturing to develop complex interior and exterior solutions. These solutions ensure structural integrity of the aircraft, help aircraft take off and land, stay trim in the air, move forward, carry cargo and conduct rescues. We delight our customers with superior products and best-in-class service. Our global team is committed to continuous improvement – we work hard to make our solutions lighter-weight, stronger and more technically advanced, so that plane travel can be safer, more affordable and more sustainable in the years to come. We are looking for the best and brightest to fly and land with us!

Diversity drives innovation; inclusion drives success. We believe a multitude of approaches and ideas enable us to deliver the best results for our workforce, workplace, and customers. We are committed to fostering a culture where all employees can share their passions and ideas so we can tackle the toughest challenges in our industry and pave new paths to limitless possibility.

WE ARE REDEFINING AEROSPACE.
  • Please consider the following role type definitions as you apply for this role.

Onsite: Employees who are working in Onsite roles will work primarily onsite. This includes all production and maintenance employees, as they are essential to the development of our products.

Hybrid: Employees who are working in Hybrid roles will work regularly both onsite and offsite. Ratio of time working onsite will be determined in partnership with your leader.

Remote: Employees who are working in Remote roles will work primarily offsite (from home). An employee may be expected to travel to the site location as needed.

Regardless of your role type, collaboration and innovation are critical to our business and all employees will have access to digital tools so they can work with colleagues around the world – and access to Collins sites when their work requires in-person meetings.

Some Of Our Competitive Benefits Package Includes
  • Medical, dental, and vision insurance
  • Three weeks of vacation for newly hired employees
  • Generous 401(k) plan that includes employer matching funds and separate employer retirement contribution, including a Lifetime Income Strategy option
  • Tuition reimbursement program
  • Student Loan Repayment Program
  • Life insurance and disability coverage
  • Optional coverages you can buy: pet insurance, home and auto insurance, additional life and accident insurance, critical illness insurance, group legal, ID theft protection
  • Birth, adoption, parental leave benefits
  • Ovia Health, fertility, and family planning
  • Adoption Assistance
  • Autism Benefit
  • Employee Assistance Plan, including up to 10 free counseling sessions
  • Healthy You Incentives, wellness rewards program
  • Doctor on Demand, virtual doctor visits
  • Bright Horizons, child and elder care services
  • Teladoc Medical Experts, second opinion program
  • And more! 

Nothing matters more to Collins Aerospace than our strong ethical and safety commitments. As such, all U.S. positions require a background check, which may include a drug screen.

Note
  • Background check and drug screen required (every external new hire in the U.S.)
  • Drug Screen only performed on re-hires who have been gone for more than 1 year

Raytheon Technologies is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age or any other federally protected class.

title: Marketing Manager, Private Label & Licensed Brands
description:
Bimbo Canada is Canada’s largest bakery, operating for more than 100 years. It is a leading producer and distributor of fresh packaged breads and snacks with more than 1,000 products across 18 brands Canadians know and love, like Dempster’s®, Stonemill®, Villaggio®, Vachon® cakes and Takis®. Bimbo Canada is proud to feed Canadian families with safe, high-quality products they can trust made by Canadians, for Canadians at 16 bakeries, 14 distribution centres and 191 depots across the country. Bimbo Canada is a wholly owned subsidiary of Grupo Bimbo, the world’s largest baking company. Together, they are nourishing a better world with delicious baked goods and snacks by building a sustainable, highly-productive and deeply-humane company. We are dedicated to building a diverse workplace that promotes equity and belonging, where all associates can develop and contribute to the transformation of our company, the baking industry and our communities. For more, visit www.bimbocanada.com.

Marketing Manager, Private Label & Licensed Brands

Bimbo Canada (formerly Canada Bread Company, Limited) is a leading producer and distributor of packaged fresh bread and bakery products with brands such as Dempster’s®, Villaggio®, POM®, Bon Matin®, Ben’s®, Vachon®, Hostess®, and Sara Lee®. Dempster’s is the national brand leader and a market leader in the health and well-being segment of bread products in Canada. Bimbo Canada also has partnerships with retailers and offers a wide selection of private label products. The company operates 19 bakeries and employs approximately 4,550 associates across Canada. It seeks to create value by leading innovation in products and service delivery in the bakery industry, enhancing distribution services and processes, and continuing to grow their relationship with their customers by maintaining current business and growing via innovation in white and whole grain breads, tortillas, bagels, rye, buns and rolls, and snack cakes.

As an independent business unit of Grupo Bimbo, Bimbo Canada seeks to grow their private

label business as customers are demanding more innovation. Bimbo Canada must work with their customers to maintain their current PL business and drive growth via innovation.

Markets

Canada Bread serves major grocery chains, retail outlets and foodservice operations across Canada. The company distributes branded products in the discount, mainstream and super-premium segments, and is the leading producer in most major bakery categories. Bimbo Canada has strong relationships with their customers and produces a range of private label products for grocery.

Position Summary

Lead the private label business and work with our license brands (Sunmaid and WW) to drive growth with our customers. The private label team must work with our senior sales team to develop their customer’s PL plans. It is important for the Marketing Manager to understand our customer’s private label long term strategy and how this strategy affects the growth of Bimbo Canada. The team in cooperation with operations needs to ensure production thresholds are met by working with cross functional teams at Bimbo Canada. By working with cross functional teams, the private label team will help drive volume in bread categories which may include a portfolio within sliced breads (white, wheat, grains) and meal occasions (hotdog/hamburger buns, tortillas, English muffins, and bagels). The private label business is exceptionally important to Canada Bread as it builds relationships with our customers and keeps our plants filled contributing to capacity efficiency. In addition, this position will manage our license brands which includes WW and Sunmaid. This position requires someone who is entrepreneurial, has a passion for food, the customer and consumer. This position requires someone who has exceptional relationship building skills, strong knowledge of how the Canadian grocery industry operates, strong strategic skills, problem solving skills, business analytical thinking, good communication skills and project management skills (i.e., Working closely with cross functional stakeholders).

Position Responsibilities
  • Primary responsibility is to develop the annual marketing plan for private label working with our sales team and our major customers. This team will work with our customers and their RFP process taking into consideration what is good for the business as well as the consumer driving volume and profit for Bimbo Canada.
  • Secondary responsibility is to manage our relationship with Weight Watchers and ensure we meet our annual targets. Working with the Sunmaid team to ensure we meet our annual business plan.
  • Strategic lead for respective category for business reviews, marketing plans, and customer presentations for private label, WW and Sunmaid.
  • Budget management and reporting (processing, tracking, reporting)
  • Lead product launches including innovation/renovation explorations, packaging improvements & development of sales materials
  • Work with cross functional teams primarily production, supply chain, purchasing, sales on several projects (i.e., innovation, product renovation, packaging updates, sales presentations, and communication plan etc. (both internally and externally).
  • Periodic/Monthly reporting of business performance to identify key performance drivers, opportunities, and potential threats for the brands/segments.
  • Optimize Private Label dashboard to ensure we understand which product launches are successful or not and determine how to optimize innovation in the future
  • Work with AMM to gather and analyze relevant market data (Margin Minder, Nielsen Workstation Plus, Homescan) to identify & action insights as required.
  • Develop, recommend, and execute appropriate consumer and customer strategies/ tactics associated with new product launches (this includes packaging and customer sell story).
  • Develop sound Commercial strategies and lead multidisciplinary teams that include Manufacturing, Sales, Finance, R&D, Supply Chain, and Category Management to achieve outlined objectives.
  • Responsible for managing Assistant Marketing Manager Private Label and license brands for success through alignment of goals with effective coaching and guidance
  • Develop well written business cases
  • Manage private label portfolio for profitable growth through sku rationalization & efficient SKU assortment
  • This position may require some travel (less than 5%)
Preffered Hiring Criteria
  • Degree in Business plus 3-5 years marketing or customer marketing experience within a consumer package goods or retailer environment. Specifically the ideal candidate will have worked for one of the top retailers: Loblaws, Sobeys, Metro or Walmart.
  • Demonstrated ability to develop commercial initiatives and lead cross functional teams
  • Must possess excellent strategic, analytical, presentation, organizational and interpersonal skills
  • Must be proactive and performance driven, have a bias for action and be able to work under pressure in a fast -paced environment.
  • A strong team player, with well-developed “people interaction” skill set
  • Requires the ability to adapt easily to changing market dynamics & comfortable with ambiguity
  • Ability to influence externally and internally via presentations, cross functional team meetings etc.
  • Can demonstrate and show a track record of successfully commercialized new products (innovation)
  • Adept with Microsoft Office, AC Nielsen and Web navigation
  • Contributes to a positive team culture that is based on trust, mutual respect and valuing each other/.
  • Candidate requires a valid drivers license.
Please note all offers of employment at Canada Bread Company, Limited are conditional upon the successful completion of a pre-hire background check. This may include anything up to and including a criminal history check, reference checks and/or credit check.

Canada Bread Company, Limited is an equal opportunity employer that embraces diversity in the workplace and encourages applications from qualified women, men, visible minorities, aboriginal peoples and persons with disabilities. We welcome applications from all interested individuals; however only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Bimbo Canada is Canada’s largest bakery, operating for more than 100 years. It is a leading producer and distributor of fresh packaged breads and snacks with more than 1,000 products across 18 brands Canadians know and love, like Dempster’s®, Stonemill®, Villaggio®, Vachon® cakes and Takis®. Bimbo Canada is proud to feed Canadian families with safe, high-quality products they can trust made by Canadians, for Canadians at 16 bakeries, 14 distribution centres and 191 depots across the country. Bimbo Canada is a wholly owned subsidiary of Grupo Bimbo, the world’s largest baking company. Together, they are nourishing a better world with delicious baked goods and snacks by building a sustainable, highly-productive and deeply-humane company. We are dedicated to building a diverse workplace that promotes equity and belonging, where all associates can develop and contribute to the transformation of our company, the baking industry and our communities. For more, visit www.bimbocanada.com.

Please note that all applicants that will be considered for this role must be double vaccinated for COVID-19. Successful candidates will also be required to provide proof of their vaccination status during the recruitment process.

title: Performance Marketing
description:

  • Maintain strong communication between marketing executives and internal and external stakeholders.
  • Coordinate employee meetings and communications for the marketing department.
  • Maintain & Manage Google Ads, Facebook Ads, SEO.

title: Full Stack Developer
description:
We are looking for a Full Stack Developer to produce scalable software solutions. You'll be part of a cross-functional team that's responsible for the full software development life cycle, from conception to deployment.

As a Full Stack Developer, you should be comfortable around both front-end and back-end coding languages, development frameworks and third-party libraries. You should also be a team player with a knack for visual design and utility. If you're also familiar with Agile methodologies, we'd like to meet you.

Responsibilities
  • Work with development teams and product managers to ideate software solutions.
  • Design client-side and server-side architecture.
  • Build the front-end of applications through appealing visual design.
  • Develop and manage well-functioning databases and applications.
  • Write effective APIs.
  • Test software to ensure responsiveness and efficiency.
  • Troubleshoot, debug and upgrade software.
  • Create security and data protection settings.
  • Build features and applications with a mobile responsive design.
  • Write technical documentation.
  • Work with data scientists and analysts to improve software.
  • Use CI/CD for smooth deployment.
  • Document the project and code efficiently.
  • Connect regularly with the Quality Assurance Specialist to deliver a stable app.
  • Write tests for the App.
  • Following company policies and quality procedures to ensure quality product deliverables.
  • Ensure security guidelines are always followed while developing the app.
  • Manage the code and project on Git in order to keep in sync with other team members and managers.
  • Consulting with our customer facing representatives about software system design and maintenance.
  • Interact with the Product Manager to help understand end-user feedback.
  • Maintaining software through product lifecycle including design, development, verification and bug fixes.
  • Resolve all the bugs reported by the Quality Assurance Specialist in a timely manner.
Requirements
  • Proven experience as a Full Stack Developer or similar role.
  • Experience developing desktop and mobile applications.
  • Familiarity with common stacks.
  • Knowledge of multiple front-end languages and libraries (e. g. HTML/ CSS, JavaScript, XML, jQuery).
  • Knowledge of multiple back-end languages (e. g. C#, Java, Python) and JavaScript frameworks (e. g. Angular, React, Node.js, Typescript).
  • Familiarity with databases (e. g. MySQL, MongoDB), web servers (e. g. Apache, Nginx) and UI/UX design.
  • Excellent communication and teamwork skills.
  • Great attention to detail, analytical and organizational skills.
  • Degree in Computer Science, Statistics or relevant field.
  • Firebase: Should have experience with Cloud Firestore, Push Notifications, Cloud Functions and Analytics.
  • Git: To manage and collaborate in different projects with the rest of the team.
  • Must Have: Node.js, React.js, MySQL, Git.
  • Good To Have: Github Actions, CI/CD, AWS, Typescript.

title: Registered Nurse - ER ($2730/wk)
description:
A challenging but rewarding position is open for a Registered Nurse with experience caring for patients undergoing life-threatening trauma or illnesses for a 13 week contract assignment at a state-of-the-art hospital.

You’ll experience an incredibly supportive and ambitious team at Jackson where Traveling Nurses have been building rewarding careers since 2006. Our commitment to nurses is best reflected in the many nurse-recruiter relationships that started 10 years ago and have continued to this day.

Minimum Requirements
  • Current state license in good standing with State License Board.
  • 12 months ER experience in an acute-care setting within the last 3 years.
  • At minimum, current BLS required (certifications vary by location – job may require ACLS).
  • Medical Records.
Benefits & Perks

We deeply value your commitment to improving the lives of patients, that’s why we offer a comprehensive and competitive benefits package starting your first day.
  • Full Medical Benefits & 401k Matching Plan
  • 24/7 Recruiter: Your main point of contact available by text, phone, or email
  • Competitive Referral Bonuses
  • 100% Paid Housing Available
  • Travel & License Reimbursement
Apply now and you’ll be contacted by a recruiter who will give you more information on this or other RN vacancies in the settings and locations that matter most to you.

EEO Statement

Jackson Healthcare and its family of companies are an EEO/AA Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity and expression, national origin, age, disability or protected veteran status. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all of our associates.

description:

Job Description

Alan & Grant – Our work is focused on creating innovative HR and Organizational Development Solutions aimed at Performance Improvement & Business Growth. We currently serve clients across various sectors of the Economy from locations in Jos, Port Harcourt and Lagos.

We Are Recruiting To Fill The Position Below

Job Title: Life Science Engineer

Zip/Postal Code: 100001

Location: Lagos

Job Type: Full Time

Industry: Health Care

Job Summary
  • The job holder with a background in Life Science to provide Service support activities to our customers across Nigeria.
Duties & Responsibilities
  • Contributes to achieve specific Service related targets as defined for revenues, profit, service order volume, etc. – while complying with internal rules and practices
  • Performs service activities within guidelines and in compliance with internal & customer procedures and regulations. This means mainly: Installs, repairs, maintenance and instruction of use of instruments to ensure safe and effective customer operations.
  • Provides responsive telephone and on-site support and generally work to ensure that customer is successful in the use of Life Technologies Instrumentation.
  • Assures the professional relationship with existing customers to achieve customer loyalty to our company.
  • Acts within general Service policies, business processes and procedures (PPP) and local procedures and rules
  • Delivers professional Service activities (installation and associated training, maintenance, reparation, assistance etc.) in order to provide an optimum Service support to all the local customers to achieve loyalty
  • Utilization of the Escalation Procedure as appropriate.
  • Assures own related asset management including spare parts stock, company car, telephone, tools, software and computers, calibrations, literature etc.
  • Coordinates own work schedule with relevant partners (service coordinator, team leader, colleagues). Produces timely and accurate reports of the own activities as appropriate: i.e. engineer reports, planned maintenance reports, installation reports, expense reports etc. (via email or written)
  • Assures that its own activities are in line with the activities of the rest of the local commercial organization (sales & support) and informs customers of company’s other product and services
Requirements
  • Minimum of BSc in Engineering, Life Science Electrical / Electronics, Clinical Engineering, Biomedical, or related subjects
  • Minimum of 3-5 years of cognate work experience
  • Past experience in a relevant service function and remote field based on-site work
  • Life Sciences / Biology-related or biomedical / clinical engineering university degree required
  • Very good working knowledge of computers in general with proficiency in the MS Office Suite
  • Troubleshooting knowledge and experience skills
  • Willingness to travel through Africa and Europe (50% – 75%)
  • Good verbal and written command of the English (technical) language.
Application Closing Date

Not Specified.

資格: 登録販売者 普通自動車免許（AT限定可） ※全国転勤可能な方/特徴：当社の幹部候補生となるためキャリアアップに有利 勤務時間: 9:00～22:00（休憩60分） 上記のうち、1ヶ月単位の変形労働時間制（週平均40時間以内） ※営業時間は店舗により異なる ※23:00、24:00まで営業の店舗もあり 休日・休暇: 基本週休2日 シフト制 年間休日108日以上 福利厚生: 社会保険完備 従業員持株会 社員割引購入制度 処方箋補助制度 確定拠出年金制度 定年再雇用（継続雇用制度） 社宅制度 短時間勤務制度（3歳に満たない子と同居し、養育している方が対象） 教育研修 ・新入社員研修 ・2年目社員研修 ・店長・薬局長研修 ・スーパーバイザー研修 ・新採用社員ガイダンス ・イオン・ハピコム総合研修（調剤・一般医薬品） ・ビューティーセミナー ・登録販売者研修 ・中堅育成セミナー ・海外研修 キャリアアップあり ・入社3～5年で店長に昇格。店長は店舗運営のすべてを任されます ・その後、適性に応じて店舗運営部、商品部、経営企画、開発などの本部社員へキャリアアップ可能 人事制度 ・総合職区分：ナショナル社員、リージョナル社員、ローカル社員 ・総合職区分は年1回申請により変更可 アピールポイント: #株式会社クスリのアオキをご紹介します 全国各地に調剤薬局併設のドラッグストアおよび調剤専門薬局を800以上展開。今後も店舗拡大を予定している成長企業です。（2020年春には岩手県、宮城県に出店。2020年内に山形県にも進出） #当社の原動力は4つ （1）戦略力 -専門性：調剤薬局併設の店舗展開を進めており、地域の方々のかかりつけ薬局を目指しています。 -利便性：医薬品や雑貨だけでなく食料品を充実させ、クスリのアオキだけで買い物がすべて完結する店舗づくりに取り組んでいます。 -ドミナント：専門性と利便性が高い店舗を特定の地域に集中出店することにより、お客様からの認知度を高めています。 （2）拡大力 当社はIT・物流インフラを整備し、店舗数の急増に対応できる環境を整えました。その結果、2014年～2019年の5年間に店舗数は2倍以上に拡大しています。 （3）組織力 従業員は約15,000人。従業員同士の連携やチーム同士の結束、更には店舗運営/商品/開発/管理の4本部が連携することにより、圧倒的な組織力を実現。環境の変化に対しても、組織全体で柔軟かつ迅速に対応できています。 （4）教育力 企業の成長には人材育成が不可欠だと考え、多くの経営資源を投じ、充実した研修制度を整えました。新人社員研修をはじめ、2年目社員研修、店長研修など、各キャリアにあわせた段階的な研修でしっかりサポート。その他、海外研修や社外研修など、様々な学びの場をご用意しています。 #働き方は3つの中から選択可能 -全国転勤型のナショナル社員 -転勤範囲に制限があるリージョナル社員 -転居を伴う転勤がないローカル社員 キャリアアップに有利な働き方、家事や育児と両立しやすい働き方など、社員の働きやすさとやりがいの両方を実現できるような働き方をご用意しており、自分の生活や将来のビジョンにあわせて選択可能です。また、毎年働き方の変更ができるため、ライフステージがかわっても無理なく働き続けることができます。 #手厚い福利厚生も魅力のひとつ -出産・育児支援に力を入れています。復職率は95.2%！早番固定や休業直前の部署への復帰など、職場復帰した後のフォローも万全です。 -勤務先により社宅制度の利用が可能！費用面の会社負担だけでなく、会社側でお部屋探しをしたり、家具や家電が完備しているなど、日々の仕事に影響がほとんどなく引っ越しをすることができます。帰省の費用も補助いたします。 -入社7ヶ月目よりサマーバケーション休暇を取得可能です（取得期間は5/21～9/20)。家族との旅行やご自身の趣味の時間に充てるなど、ゆっくりとリフレッシュすることができる制度です。 クスリのアオキ嬉野中川店では、ナショナル社員として活躍してくださる登録販売者を募集しています。お客様と接するお仕事なので、明るく元気な対応に努められることが最低条件！「次の主役は、私です。」そんな熱意をもって、輝かしい未来を自分の手で切り開きませんか？あなたのご応募をお待ちしています。 特徴: 社会保険完備 / 週休2日 / 育児支援あり / ボーナス・賞与あり / 交通費支給 / 自動車運転免許 / 研修制度あり / ドラッグストア 給与の備考: ■大卒・修士卒 月給230,000円～ ・基本給 150,000円～ ・一律キャリア手当 30,000円 ・一律転勤手当 20,000円 ・一律遅番手当 20,000円 ・登録販売者手当 10,000円 ■高卒・短大・専門卒 月給210,000円～ ・基本給 150,000円～ ・一律キャリア手当 10,000円 ・一律転勤手当 20,000円 ・一律遅番手当 20,000円 ・登録販売者手当 10,000円 ■諸手当（会社規定による） ・役割手当 ・時間外勤務手当 ・休日勤務手当 ・通勤手当 ・深夜勤務手当 ・単身赴任手当 等 昇給 年1回（7月） 賞与 年2回（7月・12月）※業績連動型賞与 【ナショナル社員の年収例】 ・一般社員（高卒・高専卒・短大卒・専門卒） 月給210,000円～（年収300万円～） ・一般社員・医薬品登録販売者（大卒） 月給230,000円～（年収342万円～） ・店長 月給253,000～285,000円（年収400万～500万円） ・SV（スーパーバイザー） 月給310,000～320,000円（年収520万円） ・係長 月給230,000～330,000円（年収368万～580万円） ・バイヤー 月給320,000～330,000円（年収520万～700万円） ・課長 月給340,000～360,000円（年収620万～820万円） ※当社は職務給制度を導入しています。職務給とは勤続年数や年齢に関係なく、職務内容に応じて給与が支払われます。 キャリアアップにより報酬も明確です。 ※試用期間 入社後6ヶ月間（試用期間中は休職制度の適用なし。その他の条件は本採用時と同じ）

title: Journeyman Electrician
description:
• We are hiring for one of the largest electrical contractors in the state of New York. They have a few sites opening up where they are looking for an experienced electrician to work on a high profile commercial construction site. Details are below!*
  • Shift: Mon-Fri 7a-3:30p*
  • Pay:* $30-35/hr + 1.5x pay for OT
  • Location:* Manhattan, Queens
  • Job description- Must be able to perform these skills:* Installing 4 inch electrical conduit Building risers with electrical conduit

Installing switch gear & electrical service

Bending Conduit and installing Deck work

Installing panels and conduit

Reading blue prints
  • Additional Skills & Qualifications:* OSHA 30

SST 10

8-10 years of commercial high rise electrical experience
  • This position can start as soon as this week. If interested, send over a resume to cburnett@aerotek.com and I will give you a call to talk about the position and see if it 's a fit for what you're looking for as well!*

About Aerotek:

We know that a company's success starts with its employees. We also know that an individual's success starts with the right career opportunity. As a Best of Staffing® Client and Talent leader, Aerotek's people-focused approach yields competitive advantage for our clients and rewarding careers for our contract employees. Since 1983, Aerotek has grown to become a leader in recruiting and staffing services. With more than 250 non-franchised offices, Aerotek's 8,000 internal employees serve more than 300,000 contract employees and 18,000 clients every year. Aerotek is an Allegis Group company, the global leader in talent solutions. Learn more at Aerotek.com. The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: Manager
description:
Overview

 Do you love helping others?

Are you a natural leader who loves to inspire others to succeed? Do you want to be part of a community of caregivers committed to helping people feel their best? If the answer is "yes," we want you on our team at Massage Envy Gulfport . Massage Envy is the leader in accessible massage and skin care. As a manager at our Gulfport franchised location,* you'll join a wellness community that's 35,000 strong. And you have a meaningful role to play as you:
  • Rally a team of caring professionals to deliver an excellent end-to-end experience to every client every single day.
  • Build relationships with a talented team of massage therapists, estheticians, and customer service superstars to guide, support, and inspire them.
  • Own the success of an all-star location where clients want to be, and service providers want to stay.
Here's What's In It For You

The rewards of the job go beyond the difference you'll make in the lives of members and guests. We offer a culture of care that inspires you to be your best with:
  • Benefits that help you take care of you like a 401K plan, earned paid time off, and health, dental, vision, and ancillary insurance programs.
  • A healthy compensation plan that rewards your hard work with paid vacation, monthly bonuses, & commissions.
  • A dynamic, energizing environment where you're consistently challenged, never bored.
  • Leader training and development to help you grow as a manager and lead your team.
What We'll Accomplish Together

As a team, we're committed to delivering on the Massage Envy brand promise—we help you take care of you—every day to clients and employees alike. As the connector between the franchise owner, franchise staff, and clients, you're the leader of the mission, bringing everyone together to work cohesively toward that goal. Daily work in this role includes:
  • Leading the way to an amazing experience for members and guests by managing the daily operations of the location, maintaining a clean, safe, therapeutic environment for everyone and guiding the sales and customer service team to positively resolve customer challenges.
  • Helping the location move more people forward in their wellness journeys by driving membership, promoting retail sales, partnering with the franchisee to set performance goals and working with the team to achieve them.
  • Building a high-achieving team by setting clear expectations, providing ongoing training and mentorship, and reviewing performance regularly to empower team members to improve and grow.
  • Running a tight ship where every operational detail is addressed, from managing inventory and deposits to ensuring compliance with all labor and employment laws applicable to location employees (including any local and state licensing laws for massage therapists and estheticians).
  • Creating a strong workplace culture where all employees feel valued, good work is recognized, issues are resolved quickly and fairly, and everyone feels connected to the mission.
  • Modelling the Massage Envy core values of optimism, gratitude, excellence, consistency and empathy.
What It Takes To Succeed

A team is only as strong as its leader, so we're looking for people who have what it takes to bring out the best in everyone. Those who shine in this role are:
  • Smart and experienced with prior background in management, marketing, sales, service or retail and a college degree (preferred).
  • Born leaders who can motivate, coach, influence, and inspire and who aren't afraid to have tough conversations.
  • Top performers who can set goals, prioritize work, analyze business performance, and delegate effectively.
  • Problem solvers who can think on their feet, bring people to compromise, and resolve conflict.
  • Good with people, building trust and confidence and developing positive relationships with employees, members, and guests.
We Believe Our Differences Make Us Better

We're excited to hear from everyone with the skills, experience, and passion to do a great job regardless of race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

If you're ready to lead the charge to help people feel their best, we can't wait to meet you.
  • Massage Envy Franchising, LLC (“MEF”) is a national franchisor of independently owned and operated franchised locations. Each individual franchised location, not MEF or any of its affiliates, is the sole employer for all positions posted by a franchised location, and each individual franchised location is not acting as an agent for MEF or any of its affiliates. Hiring criteria, benefits and compensation are set by each individually owned and operated franchised location and may vary from location to location.

title: Senior Software Development Engineer, AWS Robotics
description:
Description

Are you interested in building a new interactive user experience for robotics? We are looking for a senior frontend or full stack engineer to design and build a new user interface that provides robotic operators the tools and services to configure, manage, and optimize robotics fleets and solutions in a number of applications including warehousing, logistics, manufacturing, the public sector, and more. Come join us if you want to build cutting-edge services in cloud robotics!

In this role, you will be building interactive graphical applications that our customers engage with on a daily basis, to simplify and streamline robotics fleet management. You will be designing, building, and launching a new service in robotics fleet management to deliver an exceptional customer experience. You will own the visualization for managing robot operations at scale. You will work closely with customers and your team to architect and develop the best technical design and approach. You are passionate about being part of a truly innovative team that welcomes, celebrates, and leverages a diverse set of backgrounds and skillsets to deliver results.

Mentorship

Our team is dedicated to supporting new team members. Our team has a broad mix of experience levels and Amazon tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior engineers truly enjoy mentoring more junior engineers and engineers from non-traditional backgrounds through one-on-one mentoring and thorough, but kind, code reviews. We care about your career growth. We try to assign projects and tasks based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

Work/Life Balance

Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. Most days, our entire team is co-located in the office, but we’re also flexible when people occasionally need to work from home. We generally keep core in-office hours from 10am to 4pm. About half of us come in earlier and the other half of us stay later.

Inclusive Team Culture

Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.


Basic Qualifications
  • 4+ years of professional software development experience
  • 3+ years of programming experience with at least one modern language such as Java, C++, or C# including object-oriented design
  • 2+ years of experience contributing to the architecture and design (architecture, design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and current systems
  • Proficiency in modern web technologies and design, e.g. JavaScript/TypeScript, NodeJS, WebPack, CSS, HTML
  • Experience building large-scale, high-volume web applications using frontend frameworks, e.g. React/Redux and AngularJS

Preferred Qualifications

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace.
